    　　石菖蒲 【铜刀刮去皮，用嫩桑枝相拌，蒸晒干，去桑枝不用，不可犯铁器，令人吐逆】　山药 【蒸晒干】 　牛膝 【去芦，用黄精自然汁浸，捞出，换酒浸一宿。若无黄精，酒浸三日，捞出焙干】 　山萸肉 【慢火焙干】 　远志 【用甘草水浸一宿，捞起晒干，又浸晒】　巴戟 【用枸杞子汤浸一宿去心，酒浸一宿，捞起，用菊花同包，炭火焙令黄色，去菊花不用】 　续断 【酒浸软，去内里筋，文火炒半干晒】 　五味 【蜜汤浸去子，再以浆水浸一宿焙干】　茯苓 【去皮筋，捣细于水中，搅去浮者】 楮实子 【水浸三日，搅去浮者不用，捞起晒干，酒浸一宿，滤出，蒸　辰至午，焙干】 　枸杞子 【去蒂】 　熟地黄 【蒸取出，放冷，又以酒蒸，取出令干，又拌蒸三四次，勿犯铁器】 　小茴香 【酒浸一宿炒干】 　肉苁蓉 【洗酒浸一宿，刷去沙皮，劈破中心，去白膜一重如竹丝，饭上蒸从寅至未，再用酥炙黄】　杜仲 【去皮，酥炙，炒无丝】　　右为细末，各等分，酒糊为丸桐子大，每服二十九，空心温酒送下。服五日便觉身轻，十日精神爽快，二十日语言响亮，一年白发转黑，行步如飞。[126p]

    Stone Calamus: Peel with a copper knife, mix with tender mulberry branches, steam and sun-dry, removing the branches, avoid iron utensils as it can cause vomiting.

    Chinese Yam: Steam and sun-dry.

    Ox Knee: Remove the pith, soak in natural juice of Huangjing, then strain and soak in wine overnight. If Huangjing is unavailable, soak in wine for three days, strain, and dry.

    Shan Yu Meat: Slow roast until dry.

    Yuan Zhi: Soak in licorice water overnight, strain, and sun-dry, then repeat the soaking and drying.

    Ba Ji: Soak in wolfberry soup to remove the core overnight, then soak in wine overnight, strain, wrap with chrysanthemum, and roast over charcoal until yellow, discarding the chrysanthemum.

    Xu Duan: Soak in wine until soft, remove the internal sinews, and stir-fry half-dry over low heat.

    Five Flavors: Soak in honey water to remove seeds, then soak in slurry water overnight and dry.

    Fu Ling: Remove the skin and sinews, pound finely in water, discarding the floating debris.

    Mulberry Seed: Soak in water for three days, discard the floating debris, strain, sun-dry, soak in wine overnight, filter, steam from the third to noon, then dry.

    Goji Berries: Remove the stems.

    Cooked Rehmannia: Steam to extract, let cool, then steam again in wine, extract and dry, and repeat steaming three to four times, avoiding iron utensils.

    Fennel: Soak in wine overnight and then roast dry.

    Cynomorium: Wash, soak in wine overnight, scrub off sand and skin, split open, remove the white membrane like fine bamboo strands, steam from the third to the sixth hour, then roast until yellow.

    Eucommia: Remove the skin, roast until crisp and fry until there are no fibers.

    The above are finely powdered, each equal parts, mixed with wine to form pills the size of a tung seed, taking twenty-nine each time with warm wine on an empty stomach. After five days, one will feel light; after ten days, spirit will be refreshed; after twenty days, speech will be clearer; and after a year, white hair will turn black, moving swiftly like the wind.[126p]

    Shuangzhi Pill

    Treats all deficiencies, nourishes essence and vitality, fills bone marrow, strengthens sinews and bones, assists the five organs, and regulates the six bowels. Long-term use retains youth and prevents aging.

    　　老奴丸　一名苍龙丸。此方成都府崔磨去无子，欲服此药，修合未服，而崔已卒。有老奴七十之上，腰脚疼痛，曲脊而行，褚氏与此药服之。其老奴语褚氏曰：自服此药，深有灵验，诸病悉痊，房事如少壮之人。于是与褚氏通，后有孕。一日褚氏事显，其家母视之，切究其由，得其实，遂打死此老奴，因折其腿，骨髓皆满，如金色，多试有效，故名老奴丸。[129p]

    The Old Slave Pill, also known as the Azure Dragon Pill. This remedy was created in Chengdu by Cui Mo, who, desiring to have a child, intended to take this medicine but passed away before consuming it. An old slave, over seventy years of age, suffered from pain in the waist and legs, and walked hunched over. The Chu family administered this medicine to him. The old slave told the Chu family that after taking this medicine, he experienced remarkable efficacy—his ailments were all cured, and his sexual performance was like that of a young man. Subsequently, he became intimate with a member of the Chu family, resulting in pregnancy. One day, when this situation became evident, the mother of the family investigated the matter, discovered the truth, and subsequently killed the old slave, breaking his legs. The marrow was filled, appearing golden in color, and many tests showed effectiveness, thus it was named the Old Slave Pill.[129p]

    　　木香 【五钱】 　灯心 【二钱】 　大蜘蛛 【七个】 　荜澄茄　胡桃肉【另研】 　车前子 【炒】 　马蔺花 【酒浸】 　萆薢　牡蛎 【火煅】 　韭子　木通 【各一两】 　全蝎 【去毒】 　山茱萸 【去核】 　破故纸【酒浸】 　桑螵蛸 【酒浸】 　龙骨 【各一两半】 　母丁香　紫梢花　蛇床子　肉苁蓉 【酒浸】 　菟丝子 【酒蒸】 　白茯苓 【去皮】 　仙灵脾　八角茴香　巴戟【去心】 　远志 【去心】 　当归 【各二两】 　沉香 【七钱】 　干漆 【炒去烟，三两】 　熟地黄 【五两】　　右为细末，炼蜜和丸如梧桐子大，每服三十丸，空心用温酒送下，七日见效。无妇人者勿服此药，专兴阳事。如善解者，饮凉水三口。年高气衰虚耗，风湿腰脚疼痛，并宜服之。此药最灵验，添精补肾伤。去冷除风湿，扶精更起阳。老成好修合，秘密莫传扬。假之保元气，延寿得安康。一方无桑螵蛸、当归、沉香。[130p]

    Musk (5 qian), lamp wick (2 qian), large spider (7), bellflower, walnut meat (ground separately), plantago seed (fried), horse tail flower (soaked in wine), dioscorea, oyster (calcined), chives seed, wood conduit (each 1.5 liang), full scorpion (detoxified), cornelian cherry (pitted), broken old paper (soaked in wine), silkworm (soaked in wine), dragon bone (each 1.5 liang), mother clove, purple flowering branch, cf. Cnidium seed, flesh of cudweed (soaked in wine), dodder seed (steamed in wine), white poria (peeled), fairy fungus, star anise, baijiu (heart removed), distant thought (heart removed), angelica (each 2 liang), agarwood (7 qian), dry lacquer (smoked away, 3 liang), cooked rehmannia (5 liang). The above should be finely powdered, mixed with honey, and formed into pills the size of a phoenix seed. Take 30 pills at a time, with warm wine on an empty stomach, effects seen in seven days. Women should not take this medicine, as it specifically invigorates yang. If feeling overheated, drink three sips of cool water. For those aging with weak qi and experiencing pain from wind and dampness in the waist and joints, this is advisable. This medicine is highly effective, replenishing essence and nourishing kidney deficiencies. It dispels cold and wind-dampness, boosting essence and reinforcing yang. Those who are wise and careful in cultivation should not spread this secret. It preserves original qi, prolongs life, and ensures health and peace. One variant lacks silkworm, angelica, and agarwood.[130p]

    　　延生护宝丹　补元气，壮筋骨，固精健阳，通和血脉，润泽肌肤，延年益寿。　　菟丝子 【酒浸透，蒸熟，碾作饼晒干碾末，三两】 　肉苁蓉 【酒浸切焙】 　晚蚕蛾【酥少许慢火炒】 　家韭子 【四两，水淘净，用枣二两同煮，枣熟去枣，水淘净控干，再用酒浸一宿，火炒软，各净称二两】 　胡卢巴 【微炒】 　莲实 【去皮炒熟】　桑螵蛸 【炒香】 　蛇床子 【水淘净，用枣三两，同煮，枣熟去枣焙干】 　白龙骨 【各净称一两】 　干莲花蕊　乳香 【另研】 　鹿茸 【去毛酥炙】 　丁香　木香【各半两】 　麝香 【二钱】　　右除乳香、麝香、菟丝子末外，一十二味同为细末，将前菟丝子末，用浸药酒二升，文武火熬至一半，入荞麦面一两，酒调匀，下膏子内搅匀；次下乳香、麝香，不住手搅匀，轻沸熬如稠糊放冷。此膏子都要用尽。恐硬，入酒少许。与前药末和成剂，杵千余下，丸如梧桐子大，每服三十丸，早空心用温酒入炒盐少许送。静坐少时，想药至丹田，以意加减丸数。如阳道衰精滑者，空心、临卧各进一服。[131p]

    Yansheng Hubaodan

    This elixir replenishes vital energy, strengthens muscles and bones, consolidates essence and enhances yang, facilitates blood circulation, moistens the skin, and extends life.

    Ingredients:

    • Tribulus Terrestris: Soaked in wine, steamed, ground into cakes, dried, and then powdered (150g).
    • Cistanche: Soaked in wine and roasted.
    • Silkworm Moth: Lightly fried in a little oil over low heat.
    • Chives: (240g), cleaned with water, boiled with 100g of dates until the dates are soft, the dates removed, washed and dried, soaked in wine overnight, then lightly fried until soft (each weighed 100g).
    • Trichosanthes Fruit: Lightly fried.
    • Lotus Seeds: Peeled and roasted.
    • Silkworm Excrement: Fried until aromatic.
    • Cynanchum: Cleaned with water, boiled with 150g of dates until the dates are soft, and then dried.
    • White Dragon Bone: Each weighed 30g.
    • Dried Lotus Flower Stamen:
    • Frankincense: Ground separately.
    • Deer Antler: Hair removed and gently roasted.
    • Clove and Wood Fragrance: Each weighed 15g.
    • Musk: 6g.

    With the exception of frankincense, musk, and tribulus powder, mix the remaining twelve ingredients into a fine powder. Use the tribulus powder with 2 liters of medicinal wine, simmer over medium and low heat until reduced by half. Add 30g of buckwheat flour, mix thoroughly with the wine, then incorporate the frankincense and musk, stirring continuously until it thickens like paste and then cools. Use all this paste. If it becomes too hard, add a little wine. Combine this with the herbal powder to form a paste, pound it for a thousand times until it forms small pills the size of phoenix seeds. Take 30 pills each time, on an empty stomach, with warm wine and a little fried salt. Sit quietly for a time, envisioning the medicine reaching the lower dantian, adjusting the number of pills as necessary. If the yang path is weak and essence is slippery, take a dose on an empty stomach, before lying down.[131p]

    　　腽肭脐丸　治证同前。
    　　腽肭脐 【一对】 　鹿角胶　鹿角霜　鹿茸 【各二两】 　熟地黄　胡卢巴　菟丝子【酒蒸】 　巴戟 【去心】 　锺乳粉 【研】 　乳香 【研】 　牛膝 【酒浸】 　肉苁蓉 【酒浸】 　当归　小茴香 【炒】 　天雄 【去皮】 　附子【各一两】 　沉香 【半两】 　朱砂 【二钱，研】 　麝香 【一钱，研】　　右，先将腽肭脐酒浸一宿，煮烂，捣成膏，将浸药酒化麋鹿胶霜同为膏；次下另研乳香、麝香、朱砂乳粉末；其余药修制了，亦研为细末，再于乳钵内同研千百下；别用羊白腰子三对，羊白脊髓五条，酒煮熟烂，研为膏，同腽肭脐、麋鹿角胶搜拌药末，成剂得所。若稍干入酒糊些少，同搜和，入臼内，捣三五千杵，丸如梧桐子大，窨一宿，慢火上焙干，用无油罐子盛，用厚纸密封罐口。每服三十丸，加至五七十丸，空心，用温酒送下。[132p]

    Tui Nai Qi Wan

    Indications: Same as above.

    Ingredients:

    • Tui Nai Qi (a pair)
    • Deer antler glue
    • Deer antler powder
    • Deer velvet (each two taels)
    • Cooked rehmannia
    • Wolfberry
    • Cuscuta (wine-steamed)
    • Morinda root (with heart removed)
    • Powdered boar's milk (finely ground)
    • Frankincense (finely ground)
    • Achyranthes (wine-soaked)
    • Cistanche (wine-soaked)
    • Angelica
    • Fennel (stir-fried)
    • Tianxiong (peeled)
    • Aconite (each one tael)
    • Agarwood (half a tael)
    • Cinnabar (two qian, ground)
    • Musk (one qian, ground)

    Preparation: First, soak the Tui Nai Qi in wine overnight, then cook until tender and mash into a paste. Combine the soaked medicinal wine with deer antler glue and powder into a paste. Next, add the ground frankincense, musk, and powdered cinnabar to the paste. Prepare the remaining herbs as well, grinding them into a fine powder, then grind all together in a mortar thoroughly. Separately, use three pairs of sheep kidneys and five strips of sheep spinal cord, boil them in wine until tender, and mash into a paste. Mix this with the Tui Nai Qi and the deer antler glue powder mixture to form a medicinal preparation. If slightly dry, add a little wine paste, mix well, and pound in a mortar for three to five thousand strokes, forming pills the size of paulownia seeds. Let them ferment overnight and then bake slowly until dry in an oil-free jar, sealing the jar tightly with thick paper.

    Dosage: Take thirty pills, gradually increasing to fifty to seventy pills, on an empty stomach, with warm wine to wash down.[132p]

    　　椒红丸　壮筋骨，益血脉，悦颜色。　　蜀椒 【去目并合口者炒出汗，三两】 　牛膝 【去苗，酒浸三宿，洗净晒干，四两】　石斛 【去根】 　巴戟 【去心】 　吴茱萸 【汤泡焙干】 　硫黄 【细末水飞】 　桂 【去粗皮】 　木香 【各一两】 　附子 【炮去皮脐】 　菟丝子【酒蒸晒】 　苁蓉 【酒浸去皱皮炙】 　磁石 【火烧酢淬细研水飞】 　鹿茸 【去皮酥炙，各二两】 　生地黄 【五两，取汁熬为膏】　　右为细末，入别研药和匀，炼蜜和捣二三百杵，丸如梧桐子大，每服三十丸，空心，用盐汤送下。[133p]

    　　何首乌丸　治男子元脏虚损，发白再黑，填精补髓。　　何首乌 【半斤】 　肉苁蓉 【六两】 　牛膝 【四两】　　右将何首乌同枣一层，何首乌甑内蒸枣软，用竹刀切焙同为末，用枣肉和丸如梧桐子大，每服五七丸，嚼马蔺子服酒下，食前。一服渐加一丸，日三服，至四十九丸即止，却减丸数服，其效如神。[137p]

    The Divine Immortal Jiushengzi Pills stabilize the spirit and calm the soul, alter one’s appearance, facilitate immortality, extend lifespan, enrich the marrow, stabilize essence, replenish the void and boost energy, strengthen the muscles and bones, nourish the skin, restore gray hair to black, regrow lost teeth, enhance eyesight, invigorate the heart without fatigue, allow movement as if flying, providing immunity to cold and heat, and capable of curing a hundred ailments.

    　　全鹿丸 【秘方，下同】 　此药能补诸虚百损，五劳七伤，功效不能尽述。制一料服之，延年一纪。其法四人共制一鹿，分而服之；逾年又共制之，四人共制四年，则每人为一全鹿。若一人独制一料，恐久留变坏，药力不存矣。　　中鹿 【一只，不拘牝牡，缚死，去毛肚杂，洗净听用】 　鹿肉 【煮熟，横切片，焙干为末】　皮 【同杂入元汤煮膏和药末为丸】 　骨 【用酥炙为末，和肉末药末，一处和，胶捣不成丸，加炼蜜】 　人参　黄芪　白朮　茯苓　当归　川芎　生地黄　熟地黄　陈皮　天门冬　麦门冬　炙甘　　草　破故纸　续断　杜仲　牛膝　枸杞子　巴戟天　胡卢巴　干山药　芡实子　菟丝子　覆盆子　五味子　楮实子　琐阳　肉苁蓉　秋石【各一斤】 　川椒　小茴香　青盐　沉香 【各半斤】　　右各精制为末，各称分两，和匀一处，候肉并胶成，就和为丸，梧桐子大，焙干，用生黄绢作小袋五十条，每条约盛一斤，悬置透风处。用尽一袋，又取一袋。霉伏天须要火烘一二次为妙。每服八九十丸，空心临卧时，姜汤、盐汤、沸汤任下，冬月温酒送下。[142p]

    Whole Deer Pills (Secret Recipe)

    This medicine can replenish various deficiencies and heal numerous ailments, its effects cannot be fully described. Producing one batch to take extends life by a decade. The method is for four people to process one deer together and then divide it; after a year, they process it again, and after four years, each person will have one whole deer. If one person attempts to process one batch alone, it may spoil over time, and the medicinal efficacy will be lost.

    Preparation of Deer (One deer, no restriction on gender, bound and killed, skin and internal organs removed, thoroughly washed)

    Deer Meat (Boiled, sliced crosswise, and dried into powder)

    Skin (Cooked with other ingredients in broth, combined with powdered medicine to form pills)

    Bones (Roasted and powdered, mixed with meat powder and medicinal powder, kneaded together, formed into pills with added honey)

    Medicinal Ingredients: Ginseng, Astragalus, Atractylodes, Poria, Angelica, Ligusticum, Raw Rehmannia, Cooked Rehmannia, Dried Tangerine Peel, Asparagus, Ophiopogon, Honey Fried Licorice, Broken Old Paper, Dipsacus, Eucommia, Achyranthes, Goji Berries, Morinda Root, Black Soybean, Cuscus, Dried Yam, Fox Nut, Dodder Seed, Raspberry, Schisandra, Paper Mulberry, Soggy Yang, Cistanche, Qiushishi (each one pound)

    Spices: Sichuan Pepper, Fennel, Green Salt, Sandalwood (each half a pound)

    Coarse powders of each ingredient are to be finely processed, weighed in halves, mixed uniformly until the meat and glue combine, then formed into pills the size of a Chinese parasol seed. They are then dried and packed into fifty small bags made of raw yellow silk, each bag holding about one pound, and stored in a ventilated place. When one bag is finished, take another. In humid weather, it is advisable to dry them over a fire once or twice.

    Take eighty to ninety pills on an empty stomach before lying down, accompanied by ginger soup, salted soup, or boiling water as desired; in winter, warm wine can be used as well.[142p]

    　　御米酒　壮筋骨，畅经络，养精元，益神气，久服行步如飞，延年益嗣，有通仙之妙。　　真薏苡米酒 【一百斤】 　霜茄根 【切片】 　五加皮 【切】 　桑寄生【剉】 　苍耳子 【炒去刺，各半斤】 　枸杞子 【净】 　牛膝 【去卢，各一斤】　　右各制净称分两，每味分四剂，酒一百斤，亦分四坛，各入药煮三炷香，取放土地上退火性，七日即可饮。久窨尤佳。早晚随量饮，微醺为度。[143p]

    Imperial Rice Wine strengthens muscles and bones, promotes circulation, nourishes essence, benefits vitality, and with prolonged use, one walks as if flying, extending life and promoting offspring, possessing the marvelous ability to connect with immortals.

    　　斑龙二至百补丸　能固本保元，生精养血，培复天真，大补虚损，益五内而除骨蒸，壮元阳而多子嗣，充血脉，强筋骸，美颜色，增龄算，聪明耳目，黑润髭须，真王道奇方。　　鹿角 【五十两，为则新取连脑骨者佳，锯作二寸长段，长流水洗，米泔浸一宿，刷洗净晒干，同后药和入磁坛煮胶】　黄精 【八两】 　甘枸杞子　干熟地黄　菟丝子 【热水淘净】 　金樱子 【去毛子净，各四两】 　天门冬 【去心】 　麦门冬 【去心】 　川牛膝 【酒洗】　楮实子 【热水洗，各二两】 　龙眼肉 【一两】　　十味同鹿角和匀，入净坛内，层层放实，用新汲淡水注坛中，平肩，以密梭布四层封口，以新砖压之，置大锅中井字架上，以木甑盖好，重汤煮三日夜，毋得间断火候，旁用小锅烧滚水，不时添注坛内并锅内，勿使干涸。[144p]

    The Banlong Erzhi Baibu Pills can consolidate the foundation and preserve vitality, generate essence and nourish blood, nurture the original true self, greatly replenish deficiencies, benefit the five internal organs while eliminating bone heat, strengthen yang and increase offspring, enrich the blood vessels, strengthen muscles and bones, enhance complexion, increase longevity, sharpen intellect, darken and enrich facial hair, and are a truly extraordinary formula of the genuine way.

    颐养补益门

    　　　　单方

    　　服茯苓法：茯苓自是神仙上药，但其中有赤筋脉，若不能去，服久不利人眼，或使人眼小。当削去皮切为方寸块，银石器中清水煮，以酥软解散为度，入细布袋中，以冷水揉搜，如作葛粉状，澄取粉而筋脉留袋中，弃去不用。用其粉以蜜和如湿香状，蒸过食之尤佳。纯黑脂麻，九蒸九暴，入水烂研，滤取白汁，银石器中熬，如作杏酪汤。更入去皮核烂研枣肉，与茯苓粉一处搜和食之，尤奇。【东坡，下同】[146p]

    Nourishing and Beneficial Gate

    Single Recipe

    Method of consuming Poria: Poria is undoubtedly a divine medicine, but it contains red fibers; if these are not removed, prolonged consumption may not benefit the eyes and could make them smaller. One should slice it into small square pieces after peeling, and cook it in clean water in a silver or stone vessel until it becomes soft and disintegrated. Place it in a fine cloth bag and knead it in cold water until it resembles starch, then strain the powder and leave the fibers in the bag to discard. Use the powder mixed with honey in a moist, fragrant manner; steaming it before consumption is especially good. Pure black sesame, steamed and sun-dried nine times, should be crushed in water and filtered to obtain the white juice, which is then boiled in a silver or stone vessel until it resembles apricot jelly soup. Finally, add crushed jujube flesh after removing the skin and pit, and mix it with the Poria powder for eating, which is particularly remarkable.[146p]

    　　服地黄法：肥嫩地黄一二寸，截去，薄纸裹两头，以生猪脑涂其肤周匝，置小盘中，挂通风处十余日自干，抖擞之出细黄粉，其肤独一一如鹅管状，其粉沸汤点，或谓之金粉汤。
    　　时雨降，多置器广庭中，所得甘滑不可名，以泼茶煮药皆美而有益正尔。食之不辍，可以长生。其次井泉甘冷者，皆良药也。干以九二化坤之六二为坎，故天一为水。吾闻之道士，人能服井华，其效与石硫黄、锺乳等，非其人亦能发背脑为疽，盖尝观之。又分至日取井水，储之有方，后七日辄生物如云母状，道士谓水中金可养炼为丹，此固尝见之者。此至浅近，独不能为，况所谓元者乎？[147p]

    Method for Consuming Di Huang: Take fat, tender Di Huang (Rehmannia) about one or two inches long, cut it off, and wrap the ends with thin paper. Coat its surface with pig brain, place it in a small plate, and hang it in a ventilated area for over ten days to dry naturally. Shake it out to obtain a fine yellow powder, which has a unique texture resembling a goose's tube. When this powder is added to boiling soup, it is also referred to as gold powder soup.

    When it rains, place this in a wide container in the courtyard, and the resulting substance is sweet and smooth beyond description. It is good for pouring into tea or cooking medicine, both being attractive and beneficial. Consuming it without pause can lead to longevity. Additionally, spring water, which is sweet and cool, serves as good medicine as well. Dry it and transform it according to the energy of the Earth’s hexagrams, thus the heavens represent water.

    I’ve heard from Taoist practitioners that if one can consume well water essence, its effects are similar to those of stone sulfur and other minerals; however, even those who are not practitioners can develop boils on their backs and heads upon experiencing it, as I have observed. Furthermore, collect well water at the right time of day, store it carefully, and after seven days, it may generate substances resembling mica. Taoists say that gold in the water can be nourished and refined into elixirs, which I have indeed witnessed. This is quite simple, yet one alone cannot achieve it, much less what is termed the original essence.[147p]

    　　服松脂法：松脂以真定者为良，细布袋盛，清水为沸汤煮，浮水面者，以新笊篱掠取，置新水中。久煮不出者，皆弃不用。入生白茯苓末，不制，但削去皮捣罗拌匀，每日早取三钱匕，着口中，用少熟水搅漱，仍以脂如常法揩齿毕，更啜小熟水咽之，仍漱吐如法，能牢齿、驻颜、乌髭也。
    　　炼枲耳霜法：枲耳并根苗叶实，皆濯去尘土，悬阴净洒扫地上，烧为灰，澄淋取浓汁泥，连二灶炼之，俟灰汁耗，即旋取旁釜中已枲灰汁益之，经一日夜不绝火，乃渐得霜，干瓷瓶盛。每服早晚临睡，酒调一钱匕。补暖去风驻颜，不可备言。尤治皮肤风，令人肤革滑净。每净面及浴，取少许如澡豆用尤佳，无所忌。苏昌图之父从谏宜州文学家，居于邕，服此十余年，年八十七，红润轻健，盖专得此药力也。[148p]

    Method for Consuming Pine Resin: The best pine resin is the genuine kind from Zhendingshan. Place it in a fine cloth bag and boil it in clean water to make a soup. Skim off the floating impurities with a new strainer and place them in new water. Discard any that do not come out after prolonged boiling. Add powdered fresh white poria, without processing it; simply peel, pound, and mix it well. Every morning, take three qian (approximately 9 grams) using a spoon, place it in your mouth, swish with some warm water, and then follow the usual method for cleaning your teeth with the resin. Afterward, drink a little warm water and swish and spit again following the same method. This can strengthen teeth, improve complexion, and darken hair.

    Method for Refining Zai Er Ointment: Both the Zai Er (a type of plant) along with its roots, stems, leaves, and seeds should be rinsed to remove dirt. Hang them in the shade to dry and then crush them into ash. Extract the concentrated juice from the ash and refine it over two stoves. Wait for the ash juice to reduce, then quickly transfer to a side cauldron to add the refined ash juice. Maintain a fire continuously for one day and night to gradually obtain the ointment, which should be stored in a dry porcelain jar. Take a dosage of one qian mixed with wine every morning and evening before sleeping. It warms the body, dispels wind, and improves appearance—its effects cannot be fully expressed. Particularly effective for treating skin conditions, making the skin smooth and clean. When cleansing your face or bathing, use a small amount like a soap bean for best results, with no restrictions. Su Changtu’s father, who advised the Scholar of Yizhou and lived in Yong, took this for over ten years and reached eighty-seven years of age, appearing rosy and vigorous, likely due to the power of this medicine.[148p]

    　　服生姜法：予昔监郡钱塘，游净慈寺，众中有僧号聪药王，年八十余，颜如渥丹，目光烱然，问其所能，盖诊脉知吉凶，如智缘者。自言服生姜四十年，故不老云。姜能健脾温肾，活血益气。其法取生姜之无筋滓者，然不用子姜，错之并皮裂取汁，贮器中，久之澄去上黄而清者，取其下白而浓者阴干，刮取如面，谓之姜乳，以蒸饼，或飰搜和丸如梧子，以酒或盐米汤吞数十粒，或取末置酒食茶饮中食之，皆可。聪云：山僧孤贫，无力治此，正尔和皮嚼烂，以温水咽之耳。初固辣，稍久则否，今但觉甘美而已。[149p]

    Method of Consuming Fresh Ginger: In the past, while overseeing the county of Qiantang, I visited the Jingci Temple, where there was a monk named Congyue Wang, over eighty years old, with a complexion like flushed cinnabar and eyes shining brightly. When I inquired about his abilities, it seemed he could diagnose pulses and know fortunes, much like a wise person. He claimed to have consumed fresh ginger for forty years, which is why he did not age. Ginger can strengthen the spleen, warm the kidneys, invigorate the blood, and enhance energy.

    The method involves selecting fresh ginger that has no fibrous residue; however, do not use young ginger. The ginger should be crushed along with its skin to extract its juice, which is then stored in a container. After some time, the top yellow liquid is discarded, and the clearer liquid below it is collected and dried in the shade until it resembles fine flour, known as ginger milk. This can be mixed with steamed cakes or formed into small balls the size of walnut, taken with alcohol or salt rice soup, swallowing dozens of pellets at a time. Alternatively, the powder can be added to various foods or beverages.

    Congyue Wang remarked: "As a monk, I am poor and can't afford to prepare this properly; I simply chew the skin and swallow it with warm water." At first, it is indeed spicy, but after a while, it becomes pleasant. Now, I find it only sweet and delightful.[149p]

    　　服云母法：上白云母二十斤，薄劈，以露水八斗作汤，分半淘洗二次。又二斗作汤，纳芒硝十斤，木器中渍二十日，取出绢袋盛悬屋上，勿见风日，令燥，以鹿皮为囊揉之。从旦至午筛渣，复揉，得好粉五斗，余者弃之。以粉一斗纳崖蜜二斤，搅糊，入竹筒内，薄削，封口漆固，埋北垣南崖下，入地六尺，覆土，春夏四十日，秋冬三十日，出之当成水。若洞洞不消，更埋三十日。此水能治万病及劳气风疼。每以温水一合和服之，日三服。十日小便当变黄，二十日腹中寒澼消，三十日龋齿更生，四十日不畏风寒，五十日诸病皆愈，颜色日少，长生神仙。【《千金》】[150p]

    Method of Using Muscovite:
    Take twenty catties of white muscovite and thinly split it. Use eight dou of dewdrops to make a soup, divide it in half, and wash it twice. Then make an additional soup with two dou, adding ten catties of natron, and soak it in wooden containers for twenty days. Afterward, take it out, place it in a silk bag, and hang it in a room without exposure to wind or sunlight to dry. Use deer skin to make the bag and knead it. From dawn until noon, sift out the residue and knead it again to obtain five dou of fine powder, discarding the rest. Take one dou of this powder and mix it with two catties of cliff honey, stirring it into a paste. Place it in a bamboo tube, slice it thinly, seal the opening with lacquer, and bury it under the southern slope of the northern wall, six feet deep. Cover it with soil. In spring and summer, leave it for forty days; in autumn and winter, thirty days. When you take it out, it should turn into water. If it has not dissolved properly, bury it for another thirty days. This water can cure myriad ailments and relieve fatigue, wind, and pain. It should be taken with one cup of warm water, three times a day. After ten days, the urine should turn yellow; after twenty days, the internal cold and dampness will dissipate; after thirty days, decayed teeth will regenerate; after forty days, one will no longer fear wind or cold; and after fifty days, all ailments will be cured, with the complexion improving daily, leading to long life and becoming a celestial being.[150p]

    　　雷斅曰：凡使云母黄黑者，厚而顽赤色者，经妇人手把者，并不中用。须光莹如冰色者为上。每一斤用小地胆草、紫背天葵、生甘草、地黄汁各一镒，干者细銼，湿者取汁了，于瓷埚中安置，下天池水三镒，着火煎七日夜，水火勿令失度，云母自然成碧玉浆在埚底，却以天池水猛投其中搅之，浮如蜗涎者即去之。如此三度，淘净。取沉香一两捣作末，以天池水煎沉香汤二升，以水分为三度，再淘云母浆了，日晒任用。抱朴子曰：服五云之法，或以桂葱水玉，化之为水；或以露于磁器中，以原水熬之为水；或以消石合于筒中，埋之为水；或以蜜搜为酪；或以秋露渍之百日。韦囊挺以为粉，或以无颠草樗血合饵之。服至一年百病除，三年反老成童，五年役使鬼神。[151p]

    Lei Xia said: As for using muscovite that is yellow-black, thick, and stubborn red in color, which has been handled by women, it is not effective. The best is that which is shiny and clear like ice. For every pound, use one ounce of small earth gall, purple-backed daylily, sweet licorice, and prepared rhubarb juice, finely ground if dry, and extracted for juice if wet. Place these in a porcelain crucible, add three ounces of water from the Tianchi lake, and apply heat to simmer for seven days and nights, carefully controlling the water and fire. The muscovite will naturally form a jade-like paste at the bottom of the crucible. Then, vigorously pour in Tianchi water and stir. Remove any floating froth as it appears. This process should be done three times to purify it. Take one tael of agarwood and grind it into powder; use two liters of water from Tianchi to simmer the agarwood, dividing the water into three portions, and then re-purify the muscovite paste. Let it dry in the sun for practical use. The Baopuzi states: When taking the method of five clouds, one may use桂葱水玉 (cassia and garlic water jade) to transform it into water; or use dew in ceramic containers and boil it with original water; or combine quicklime in a tube and bury it to make water; or gather honey to make curd; or soak in autumn dew for a hundred days. Grind the materials with powdered herb or combine with the blood of the Ailanthus tree for use. Take it for a year, and all diseases will be cleared; after three years, one will return to youth; after five years, one can command spirits and deities.[151p]

    　　炼云母粉法：八九月间，取云母以矾石拌入瓦罐内，封口二伏时则自柔软，去矾；次日取百草头上露水浸之百日，韦囊挺以为粉。时珍曰：道书言盐汤煮云母可为粉。又云云母一斤，盐一斗渍之，铜器中，蒸一日，臼中捣成粉。又云：云母一斤，白盐一升，同捣细入重布袋，按之令盐味尽，悬高处风干，自然成粉。【胡演】[152p]

    Method for refining mica powder: In August and September, take mica and mix it with alum stone in a clay pot, sealing the mouth. After two days, it becomes soft; remove the alum. The next day, soak it in dew from the tops of a hundred grasses for a hundred days, then pound it in a leather pouch to make powder. Shizhen stated: Daoist texts say that boiling mica in salt water can yield powder. It is also said that for one pound of mica, soak it in one dou of salt in a copper vessel, steam for one day, and then crush it in a mortar to make powder. Additionally, it is noted that for one pound of mica and one liter of white salt, pound them finely into a heavy cloth bag, press it to extract all the salt flavor, and then hang it in a high place to air dry, which will naturally turn it into powder.[152p]

    　　服白石英法：白石英一斤，打成豆大，于砂盆中，和粗砂着水，按二三千下，洗净又挼，仍安柳箕中，入蒿叶少许同水熟挼至光净，即以绵袋盛悬门上。每日未梳前，以水或酒吞七粒，用饭二匙压下小腹。一切秽恶，白酒牛肉，石家所忌者，皆不忌。久则新石推出陈石。石常在小腹内，温暖则气息调和，经脉通达，腰肾坚强，百病自除。石若得力，一斤即止。若不得力，十斤亦须服。此物光滑，既无浮碎着人肠胃作疮，又无石气发作诸病也。　　又法：泽州白石英光净无点翳者，打小豆大，去细者，水淘净，袋盛，悬罐内，清水五大升，煮汁一升，澄清平旦服，以汁煮粥更佳。服后饮酒二三杯，可行百步。一袋可用二十度。如无力，以布裹埋南墙下三尺土内百日，又堪用也。[153p]

    Method of Consuming White Quartz:

    Take one pound of white quartz, crush it until it is the size of beans, and place it in a sand basin. Mix it with coarse sand and water, pressing it down two to three thousand times. Wash it clean and knead it again, then place it in a willow sieve. Add a small amount of mugwort leaves and water, and knead until smooth and bright. Finally, store it in a cotton bag and hang it above the door.

    Every day before combing your hair, take seven grains with water or wine and press down your lower abdomen with two spoonfuls of rice. You will not be affected by anything foul or evil, nor by white liquor or beef, which are usually to be avoided. Over time, new stones will push out the old ones. The stone remains warm in the lower abdomen, harmonizing the breath, facilitating the flow of meridians, strengthening the waist and kidneys, and eliminating all diseases. If the stone is effective, one pound is sufficient. If it is not effective, even ten pounds must be consumed.

    This substance is smooth, and it does not cause floating fragments to harm the intestines and stomach or trigger diseases due to stone.

    Another Method:

    The pure white quartz from Zhezhou, which is free from spots and imperfections, should be crushed to the size of small beans. Remove any fine particles, rinse it thoroughly with water, and store it in a bag to hang in a jar with five large sheng of clean water. Boil one sheng of the liquid and consume it clear in the early morning, which is even better if cooked with porridge. After taking it, drink two to three cups of wine, and you can walk a hundred steps. One bag can be used for twenty doses. If it is ineffective, wrap it in cloth and bury it three feet deep in the south wall for a hundred days, and it can still be used.[153p]

    　　三皇真人炼丹方：丹砂一斤，研末重筛，以醇酒沃之如泥状，盛以铜盘，置高阁上，勿令妇女见。燥则复以酒沃令如泥，阴雨疾风则藏之。尽酒三斗，乃曝之三百日，当紫色。斋戒沐浴七日，静室，饭丸梧子大，常以平旦向日吞三丸。一月三虫出，半年诸病瘥，一年须发黑，三年神人至。【《太上元变经》，下同】[154p]

    The method of the Three Sovereigns for refining elixirs: Take one pound of cinnabar, grind it to a fine powder and sift it well, then moisten it with pure wine until it resembles a muddy state. Place it in a copper dish and set it on a high shelf, ensuring that women do not see it. If it dries out, moisten it again with wine until it is muddy. During rainy, windy weather, conceal it. After consuming three dou of wine, expose it for three hundred days, and it will turn purple. Fast and bathe for seven days, sit quietly in a room, and form pills the size of a wild goose egg, swallowing three pills each dawn facing the sun. In one month, three worms will emerge; in six months, various illnesses will be cured; in a year, hair will turn black; and in three years, celestial beings will arrive.[154p]

    　　小丹服法：雄黄、柏子仁各二斤，松脂炼过十斤，合捣为丸，每旦北向服五丸。百日后，拘魂制魄，与神人交见。
    　　小神丹方：真丹末三斤，白蜜六斤，搅合，日曝至可丸，丸麻子大，每旦服十丸。一年白发反黑，齿落更生，身体润泽，老翁成少。【抱朴子，下同】
    　　服脂麻法：上党胡麻三斗，淘净甑蒸，令气遍日干，以水淘去沫，再蒸，如此九度，以汤脱去皮，簸净炒香为末，白蜜或枣膏丸弹子大，每温酒化下一丸，日三服。忌毒鱼狗肉生莱菔。至百日，能除一切痼疾；一年身面光泽，不饥；二年白发返黑；三年齿落更生；四年水火不能害；五年行及奔马。久服长生。若欲下之，饮葵菜汁。一方为末，未食前，水或酒服方寸匕，日二。[155p]

    Small Dan Method: Take two pounds each of realgar and cedar nuts, and ten pounds of pine resin processed. Combine and grind into pills. Take five pills facing north every morning. After a hundred days, you can bind the soul and control the spirit, and meet with divine beings.

    Small Divine Elixir Recipe: Take three pounds of real elixir powder and six pounds of white honey, mix them together and expose them to the sun until they can be formed into pills, each the size of a sesame seed. Take ten pills every morning. After a year, white hair will turn black, lost teeth will regrow, the body will become supple, and an old man will become youthful.

    Method of Using Sesame Fat: Take three dou (approximately 10.5 liters) of Upper Party black sesame, wash it clean, steam it thoroughly, allowing the aroma to pervade daily. Rinse the foam away with water, steam it again, repeating this process nine times. Use broth to remove the skins, winnow and roast it until fragrant, then grind it into powder. Form pills the size of a ball using white honey or jujube paste. Take one pill dissolved in warm wine, three times a day. Avoid toxic fish, dog meat, and raw radish. After a hundred days, it can eliminate all chronic diseases; after a year, the body and face will be radiant, with no hunger; after two years, white hair will turn back to black; after three years, lost teeth will regrow; after four years, water and fire cannot harm you; and after five years, you will be able to walk and run like a horse. Long-term consumption leads to longevity. If you wish to induce a purge, drink juice from the sunflower plant. For this, take the powder before meals, using a thumb-sized spoon with water or wine, twice a day.[155p]

    　　服黄精法：黄精根茎不限多少，细銼，用流水掉去苦汁，九蒸九曝，食之。或阴干捣末，每日水调服，任多少。忌食梅实。一年内变老为少，久久成地仙。【《圣惠方》】
    　　曜仙神隐者，以黄精细切一石，用水二石五斗煮之，自旦至夕，候冷以手挼碎，布袋榨取汁煎之，渣干为末，同入釜中，煎至可丸，丸如鸡子大，每服一丸，日三丸。服之绝粮轻身，除百病。渴则饮水。
    　　服萎蕤法：二月九月，采萎蕤根切碎一石，以水二石煮之，从旦至夕，以手挼烂，布囊榨取汁熬稠，其滓晒为末，同熬至可丸，丸如鸡头子大，每服一丸，白汤下，日三服。导气脉，强筋骨，治中风湿毒，去面皱颜色。久服延年。
    　　服菟丝法：取实一斗，酒一斗浸，暴干再浸，又暴，令酒尽乃止，捣筛，每酒服二钱，日二服。此药治腰膝去风，兼能明目。久服令人光泽，老变为少。十日外饮啖，如汤沃雪也。【抱朴子】[156p]

    Method for Consuming Huang Jing: There is no specific amount for the rhizome of Huang Jing; it should be finely grated. Rinse it in running water to remove the bitter juice, then steam it and dry it nine times. Consume it. Alternatively, dry it in the shade and grind it into powder, taking it daily mixed with water, in any amount desired. Avoid eating plum fruit. Within a year, one can transform from old to young, and with prolonged consumption, one may become an earth immortal.

    Yao Xian, the Hidden Sage, finely chopped one stone of Huang Jing and boiled it in two and a half stones of water from morning until evening. After it cooled, he crushed it by hand, extracted the juice through cloth, and boiled the juice. The residue was dried and ground into powder, then included in the boiling potion until it could be formed into pills the size of a chicken egg. Take one pill each time, three times a day. Consuming this makes one light and free from hunger, curing numerous ailments. Drink water when thirsty.

    Method for Consuming Wei Rui: In the second and ninth months, collect and finely chop one stone of Wei Rui roots, boiling it in two stones of water from morning until evening. Mash it by hand, extract the juice through cloth, and reduce it to a thick consistency. Dry the residue to powder, and boil it until it can be formed into pills the size of a chick's head. Take one pill with warm water, three times a day. It opens the energy pathways, strengthens the bones, treats wind-dampness toxicity, and removes facial wrinkles and discoloration. Long-term consumption prolongs life.

    Method for Consuming Tu Si: Take one dou of its seeds and one dou of wine to soak, dry quickly, and soak again, drying once more, stopping when the wine is completely absorbed. Grind and sift it; take two qian of this mixture with wine, twice daily. This remedy treats waist and knee pain, dispels wind, and improves eyesight. Long-term use brings a healthy glow, reversing aging. Within ten days, consuming it is as enjoyable as snow melting in soup.[156p]

    　　服五味子法：五六月宜常服五味子汤，以益肺金之气，在上则滋源，在下则补肾。其法以五味子一大合，木臼捣细磁瓶中，以百沸汤投之，入少蜜，封置火边，良久汤成，任饮。
    　　养血返精丸：破故纸炒二两，白茯苓一两为末，没药五钱，以无灰酒浸高一指，煮化和末，丸梧子大，每服三十丸，白汤下。昔有人服此，至老不衰。盖破故纸补肾，茯苓补心，没药养血，三者既壮，自然身安。【《集验方》】
    　　服甘菊法：王子乔变白增年方，用甘菊，三月上寅日采苗，名曰玉英；六月上寅日采叶，名曰容成；九月上寅日采花，名曰金精；十二月上寅日采根茎，名曰长生。四味并阴干百日等分，以成日合捣千杵为末，每酒服一钱匕；或以蜜丸，梧子大，酒服七丸，一日三服。百日轻润，一年发白变黑，服之三年齿落再生，五年八十老人变为儿童也。孟诜云：正月采叶，五月五日采茎，九月九日采花。【《玉函方》】[157p]

    Method of Consuming Schisandra Berries: During May and June, it is advisable to regularly consume a soup made from schisandra berries to enhance the lung's metal energy; this nourishes from above and supplements the kidneys from below. The method involves taking one large measure of schisandra berries, grinding them finely in a mortar, placing them in an unglazed ceramic vessel, pouring in boiling water, adding a little honey, sealing it, and placing it by the fire for a long time until the soup is prepared. It can then be consumed freely.

    Blood Nourishing and Essence Returning Pills: Take two taels of broken old paper and one tael of white poria, grind them into a powder, and add five qian of myrrh. Soak in ash-free wine up to one finger high, then boil to dissolve and mix with the powder. Form into pills the size of jujubes, taking thirty pills at a time with warm water. In the past, someone who took this remained vigorous into old age. The broken old paper nourishes the kidneys, poria nourishes the heart, and myrrh nourishes the blood; when these three are strengthened, the body will naturally be at peace.

    Method of Consuming Sweet Chrysanthemum: Wang Ziqiao's method for prolonging life involves using sweet chrysanthemum. In March, on the day of the tiger, young shoots are harvested, called "Jade Blossom"; in June, on the same day, leaves are collected, called "Bringing Completion"; in September, on the same day, flowers are picked, called "Golden Essence"; and in December, on that day, roots are gathered, called "Long Life." All four ingredients should be dried in the shade for one hundred days, then ground finely using a pestle. Each time, consume one qian (a small measure) with wine; alternatively, form into pills the size of jujubes and take seven pills with wine three times a day. After a hundred days of mild nourishment, hair can turn from white to black, and after three years of consumption, lost teeth may regenerate; after five years, an eighty-year-old may become like a child. Meng Shen stated: collect leaves in the first month, stems on the fifth day of the fifth month, and flowers on the ninth day of the ninth month.[157p]

    　　服食白菊太清灵宝方：九月九日白菊花二斤，茯苓一斤，并捣罗为末，每服二钱，温酒调下，日三服。或合白朮丸散任意，或以炼过松脂和丸鸡子大，每服一丸。主头眩。久服令人好颜色不老。
    　　服地黄法：地黄根净洗捣绞汁，煎令稠，入白蜜更煎，令可丸，丸如梧子大，每晨温酒送下三十丸，日三服。亦可以青州枣和丸，或别以干地黄末入膏，丸服亦可。百日面如桃花，三年身轻不老，十年白发更黑，力如二十时，令人多子，神效无比，夜视有光。[158p]

    Taking the Bai Ju (white chrysanthemum) Taiming Lingbao recipe: On the ninth day of the ninth month, take two catties of white chrysanthemum flowers and one catty of Poria, grind them into a powder. Take two qian (a unit of weight) each time, mixed with warm wine, three times a day. Alternatively, mix with Bai Zhu pills as desired, or with refined pine resin to form pills the size of a chicken egg, taking one pill each time. It helps with dizziness. Long-term use improves complexion and prevents aging.

    For the Di Huang (rehmannia) method: Clean and wash the roots of rehmannia, mash and squeeze out the juice, then boil until thick. Add white honey and continue to simmer until it can be formed into pills, each the size of a walnut. Take thirty pills every morning with warm wine, three times a day. You can also mix with Qingzhou dates to form pills, or separately use dried rehmannia powder in a paste, which can also be taken in pill form. After a hundred days, the complexion resembles that of a peach blossom; after three years, the body is light and ageless; after ten years, gray hair turns black again. Strength will be like that of twenty years, it leads to many children, and has unmatched efficacy, with the ability to see at night as if there’s light.[158p]

    　　麦门冬煎：补中益心，悦颜色，安神益气，令人肥健。取新麦门冬根去心，捣熟绞汁，和白蜜银器中，重汤煮不停，手搅候如饴乃成，温酒日日化服之。
    　　服蒺藜法：蒺藜一石，七八月熟时收取日干，舂去刺，杵为末。每服二钱，新汲水调下，日三服。勿令中绝，断谷长生。服之一年以后，冬不寒，夏不热；二年老者复少，发白复黑，齿落更生；服之三年，身轻长生。【《神仙秘旨》】
    　　服天门冬法：孙真人《枕中记》云：八九月采天门冬根暴干为末，每服方寸匕，日三服。一云日可至十服。无问山中人间，久服补中益气，治虚劳绝伤，年老衰损，偏枯不随，风湿不仁，冷痹恶疮，痈疽癞疾，鼻柱败烂者服之，皮脱虫出。酿酒服，去症病积聚，风痰颠狂，三虫伏尸。除湿痹，轻身益气，令人不饥，百日延年耐老。酿酒初服微酸，久贮则香美，诸酒不及也。忌鲤鱼。[159p]

    Maimendong Decoction: It supplements the middle and benefits the heart, brightens complexion, calms the spirit, and increases energy, making one stout and healthy. Take fresh Maimendong roots, remove the core, pound them, and squeeze out the juice. Combine with white honey in a silver container, continuously boil with broth while stirring until it reaches a consistency like syrup. Warm and drink with wine daily.

    Consumption of Tribulus: Collect one stone of Tribulus in the seventh or eighth month when ripe, dry it in the sun, remove the thorns, and grind it into powder. Take two qian each time, mixed with fresh spring water, three times a day. Do not let it be interrupted, and it prolongs life. After taking it for a year, there will be no cold in winter and no heat in summer; after two years, the elderly will become youthful again, hair will return from gray to black, and lost teeth will regrow. Taking it for three years, one feels light and prolongs life.

    Consumption of Tianmendong: According to Master Sun in "Pillow Chronicles," in the eighth or ninth month, gather Tianmendong roots, dry them thoroughly, and grind into powder. Take a slice the size of a finger, three times a day. It is said that one may take up to ten doses a day. No matter whether in the mountains or on earth, long-term consumption supplements the middle and benefits energy, treats languor and injuries, counters aging and decay, eliminates ailments like wind-dampness and cold, alleviates sores, and helps with rotten nasal passages. It expels worms and any accumulation of illness. It aids against dampness and pain, lightens the body and increases energy, making one feel less hungry, extending life for a hundred days. When first brewed, it is slightly sour, but if stored long, it becomes fragrant and delightful, incomparable to other wines. Avoid eating carp.[159p]

    　　何首乌丸：专壮筋骨，长精髓，补血气。久服黑须发，坚阳道，令人多子，轻身延年。月计不足，岁计有余。何首鸟五斤，铜刀切片，干者以米泔水浸软切之；牛膝去苗一斤切；黑豆一斗淘净。用木甑铺豆一层，铺药一层，重重铺尽。瓦锅蒸至豆熟，取出去豆，暴干；换豆又蒸。如此三次为末，蒸枣肉和丸梧子大，每服三五十九，空心温酒下。忌葱蒜萝卜无鳞鱼。勿犯铁器。　　又方：用赤白何首乌各半，极大者，八月采，以竹刀削去皮切片，用米泔浸一宿，晒干，以壮妇男儿乳汁拌晒三度，候干，木臼舂为末，以密云枣肉和杵为丸如梧子大，每服二十丸，每十日加十丸，至百日止，空心，温酒盐汤任下。[160p]

    He Shou Wu Pill: This strengthens the muscles and bones, promotes essence and marrow, and replenishes blood and energy. Long-term use leads to black hair, strengthens the Yang path, and promotes fertility, aiding in weight loss and prolonging life. Monthly deficiency is not a concern, while yearly excess is noted. Take five pounds of He Shou Wu, slice with a copper knife, and soak the dried pieces in rice water until soft; one pound of cattle knee without sprouts, sliced; one bushel of black beans, thoroughly cleaned. Use a wooden steamer to layer the beans and herbs alternately until fully covered. Steam in a clay pot until the beans are cooked, then remove and dry; replace the beans and steam again. Repeat this three times to create a powder, then mix with jujube paste to form pills the size of walnuts. Take three to five pills each time, with warm wine on an empty stomach. Avoid onions, garlic, radishes, and fish without scales. Do not use iron utensils.

    Another recipe: Use equal parts of red and white He Shou Wu, the larger, harvested in August. Peel and slice with a bamboo knife, soak in rice water overnight, then dry. Mix with breast milk from strong women or men and dry thoroughly three times. Grind in a wooden mortar to a fine powder, then mix with jujube paste to form pills the size of walnuts. Take twenty pills each time, increasing by ten every ten days until reaching one hundred days, on an empty stomach, taking with warm wine or salted soup as preferred.[160p]

    　　服菖蒲法：采紧小似鱼鳞者一斤，以水及米泔浸各一宿，刮去皮切，暴干捣筛，以糯米粥和匀，更入熟蜜搜和，丸如梧子大，稀葛袋盛，置当风处，令干，每旦酒饮任下三十丸，临卧更服三十丸。服至一月消食，二月痰除。服至五年，骨髓充，颜色泽，白发黑，齿落更生。又法：用华山挺子茯苓，削如枣大方块，安新瓮内，好酒浸之，重纸封，百日乃开，其色当如饧糖，可日食一块。至百日肌体润泽，一年可夜视物。久久肠化为筋，延年耐老，面若童颜。【《经验后方》】　　又方：茯苓十斤去皮酒浸，密封下，五十日出之，取服，如博棋大，日三；亦可屑服方寸匕。凡饵茯苓，皆汤煮四五沸，或以水渍六七日。[161p]

    Method for Consuming Calamus: Gather about one pound of calamus that is small and resembles fish scales. Soak it in water and rice wash for a night, then peel and chop it. Dry in the sun, pound, and sift it. Mix with glutinous rice porridge until well blended, then add熟蜜 (cooked honey) and mix thoroughly. Form into small balls the size of jujubes, store them in a gauze bag, and place in a windy area to dry. Every morning, consume thirty balls with wine, and take another thirty before sleep. After taking for one month, food will be digested better; after two months, phlegm will be eliminated. After five years, bone marrow will be abundant, complexion will glow, white hair will turn black, and lost teeth will regrow.

    Another Method: Use Huashan calamus mushroom, cut into pieces the size of jujubes, and soak in fine wine within a new jar. Seal tightly with heavy paper and open after a hundred days. The color should be like syrup, and one can eat a piece daily. After a hundred days, the body will become moist and nourished; in a year, night vision will improve. Over time, the intestines will transform into tendons, prolonging life and delaying aging, with a youthful appearance.

    Another Recipe: Take ten pounds of poria, peel it, soak in wine, seal tightly, and after fifty days, take it out and consume pieces the size of a chess piece three times a day; it can also be consumed in small shavings. For all preparations of poria, boil in water for four to five minutes, or soak in water for six to seven days.[161p]

    　　用茯苓、松脂各二斤，醇酒浸之，和以白蜜，日三服之，久久通灵。 【《嵩高记》】
    　　服食山药法：益颜色，补下焦虚冷，小便频数，瘦损无力。用薯蓣于沙盆中研细，入铫中，以酒一大匙熬令香，旋添酒一盞，搅令匀，空心饮之，每旦一服。【《圣惠方》】[162p]

    Use two pounds each of poria and pine resin, soak them in good wine, mix with white honey, and take three doses daily for an extended period to enhance spiritual clarity.

    Method for consuming yam: It improves complexion, nourishes the lower body’s deficiency and coldness, and addresses frequent urination, weakness, and thinness. Grind the yam finely in a sand basin, put it in a pot, add a large spoonful of wine and simmer until fragrant, then add a cup of wine, stir well, and drink on an empty stomach, once each morning.[162p]

    　　服柏实法：八月连房取实，暴收去壳，研末，每服二钱，温酒下，一日三服。渴即饮水，令人悦泽。一方加松子仁等分，以松脂和丸。一方加菊花等分，蜜丸服。　　又方：尝以三月四日，采新生松叶长三四寸许，并花蕊阴干；又于深山岩谷中，采当年新生柏叶，长二三寸者，阴干为末，白蜜丸如小豆大，常以日未出时烧香，东向平持八十一丸，以酒下。服一年，延十年命；服二年，延二十年命。欲得长肌肉，加大麻、巨胜；欲心力壮健者，加茯苓、人参。此药除百病，益元气，滋五脏六腑，清明耳目，强壮不衰老，延年益寿，神验。用七月七日露水丸之，更佳。服时仍祝曰：神仙真药，体合自然。服药入腹，天地同年。祝毕，服药，断诸杂肉五辛。【《枕中记》】　　又方：五月五日采五方侧柏叶三斤，远志去心二斤，白茯苓去皮一斤，为末，炼蜜和丸梧子大，每以仙灵脾酒下三十丸，日再服。并无所忌。勿示非人。[163p]

    Method for Taking Cedar Fruit: In August, collect the fruit from the trees, remove the shells, and grind it into a powder. Take two qian with warm wine, three times a day. If thirsty, drink water; it promotes a pleasant complexion. One recipe adds equal parts pine nut kernels, mixed with pine resin and formed into pills. Another recipe adds equal parts chrysanthemum flowers, made into honey pills.

    Another recipe: On the fourth day of the third month, gather young pine leaves about three or four inches long and flower buds, and dry them in the shade; also, in deep mountain ravines, gather this year’s new cedar leaves, two to three inches long, dry and grind them into a powder. Make pills the size of small beans with white honey, and regularly burn incense before sunrise, holding eighty-one pills facing east, taking them with wine. Taking this for a year extends life by ten years; taking it for two years extends life by twenty years. To gain muscle, add hemp seeds or giant conquering herb; to strengthen the heart and body, add poria or ginseng. This medicine treats all diseases, enhances vital energy, nourishes the five internal organs, clears and sharpens the senses, strengthens and prevents aging, prolonging life, with miraculous effects. It is even better if taken on the seventh of July with dew water. When taking it, one should also recite: “True medicine of the immortals, embodied in nature. When the medicine enters the belly, heaven and earth share the same age.” After the prayer, take the medicine, and avoid consuming various meats and the five pungents.

    Another recipe: On the fifth of May, gather three jin of five-direction cedar leaves, two jin of the hearts of polygala, and one jin of peeled white poria, grind them into powder, refine honey, and form pills the size of Chinese walnuts. Take thirty pills with immortal spirit liquor twice a day. There are no specific restrictions. Do not reveal this to anyone unworthy.[163p]

    　　服食法：百炼松脂治下筛，蜜和，纳角中，勿见风日，每服一两，一日三服。服至百日耐寒暑，二百日五脏补益，五年即见西王母。　　又方：松脂十斤，炼之五度，令苦味尽，每一斤入茯苓四两，每旦水服一刀圭。能令不食而复延龄，身轻清爽。
    　　服胡桃法：凡服胡桃，不得并食，须渐渐食之。初日服一颗，每五日加一颗，至二十颗止，周而复始。常服令人能食，骨肉细腻光润，须发黑泽，血脉通润，养一切老病。
    　　服松子法：七月取松实，过时即落，难收也。去木皮捣如膏，收之，每服鸡子大，酒调下，日三服。一云服方寸匕，一云一服三合。百日身轻。三百日，日行五百里。绝谷久服，神仙。渴即饮水。亦可以炼过松脂同服之。若丸如梧桐子大，服十丸。【《圣惠方》】[164p]

    Method of Consuming Medicinal Substances: Refined pine resin is treated and filtered, mixed with honey, and placed in a horn that is kept away from wind and sunlight. Take one or two taels each time, three times a day. After consuming it for a hundred days, one will endure cold and heat; after two hundred days, it will nourish the five organs; after five years, one will see the Queen Mother of the West.

    Another Recipe: Ten pounds of pine resin are refined five times until the bitter taste is gone. For every pound, add four ounces of Poria. Consume a knife-edge worth with water each morning. This enables one to eat less and prolong life, leaving the body light and refreshed.

    Method of Consuming Walnuts: When consuming walnuts, do not eat them all at once; they should be eaten gradually. On the first day, consume one seed; every five days, add one more, until reaching twenty seeds, then repeat the cycle. Regular consumption allows one to eat well, and leads to refined and smooth flesh and bones, dark and lustrous hair, and flowing blood, nourishing all ailments of old age.

    Method of Consuming Pine Nuts: In July, collect the pine nuts, as they fall afterwards and are difficult to gather. Remove the outer shell and pound the nuts into a paste. For each dose, take an amount the size of a chicken egg and mix it with wine, taking three doses daily. Some say to consume a small spoonful; others suggest taking three heaping spoonfuls at a time. After a hundred days, the body feels light. After three hundred days, one can walk five hundred miles daily. Prolonged use will make one become a transcendent. If thirsty, drink water. They can also be consumed together with refined pine resin. If made into pills the size of sycamore seeds, take ten pills.[164p]

    　　服莲肉法：石莲肉蒸熟去心为末，炼蜜丸梧子大，日服三十丸。此仙家方也。
    　　清心宁神：用莲蓬中干石莲子肉，于砂盆中，擦去赤皮留心，同为末，入龙眼点汤服之。
    　　服鹿角法：鹿角屑十两，生附子三两，去皮脐为末，每服二钱，空心，温酒下。令人少睡，益气力，通神明。【彭祖方】
    　　补益虚羸鹿骨煎：用鹿骨一具，枸杞根二升，各以水一斗，煎汁五升，和匀，共煎五升，日二服。【《千金方》】
    　　补益虚寒：用精羊肉一斤，碎白石英三两，以肉包之，外用荷叶裹定，于一石米下蒸熟取出，去石英和葱姜，作小馄饨子，每日空腹，以冷浆水吞一百枚，甚补益。【《千金翼》】[165p]

    Method of Consuming Lotus Flesh: Steam the flesh of stone lotus until cooked, remove the heart, and grind into powder. Form into pills the size of walnuts, taking thirty pills daily. This is a method from the immortal's teachings.

    Calming the Heart and Tranquilizing the Spirit: Take dried flesh from the stone lotus seeds inside the lotus pod, rub off the red skin while retaining the heart, grind into powder, and mix with longan soup for consumption.

    Method of Consuming Deer Antler: Take ten taels of deer antler shavings and three taels of raw aconite, removing the skin and navel and grinding into powder.     Nourishing Cold Weakness: Take one pound of fine sheep meat and three taels of crushed white quartz. Wrap the meat in the quartz, then wrap it in lotus leaves and steam it under one stone of rice until cooked. Remove the quartz and the scallions and ginger, and form small wontons. Consume one hundred on an empty stomach each day with cold liquid for significant nourishment. [From the "Thousand Gold Supplement"][165p]

    　　斩三尸法：常以庚辰日去手爪，甲午日去足爪。每年七月十六日，将爪甲烧灰，和水服之，三尸九虫皆灭，名曰斩三尸。【《太上元科》】　　又方：甲寅日三尸游两手，剪去手爪甲；甲午日三尸游两足，剪去足爪甲。
    　　阴阳二炼丹：世之炼秋石者，但得火炼一法，此药须兼阴阳二炼，方为至药。火炼乃阳中之阴，得火而凝，入水则释，归于无体，盖质去味存，此离中之虚也。水炼乃阴中之阳，得水而凝，遇曝而润，千岁不变，味去质留，此坎中之实也。二物皆出于心肾二脏，而流于小肠。水火螣蛇元武正气，外假天地之水火，凝而为体。服还补太阳相火二脏，上为养命之本。空心，服阳炼；日午，服阴炼。此法极省力，与常法功用不侔。久疾服之，皆愈。有人得瘦疾且嗽，诸方不效，服此即瘳。有人病颠腹鼓，日久加喘满垂困，亦服此而安也。[166p]

    The method of severing the three corpses: On the day of Gengchen, remove the fingernails; on the day of Jiawu, remove the toenails. Every year on the sixteenth of July, burn the nails and ashes, mix them with water, and consume it. This will eliminate all three corpses and nine worms, known as the severing of the three corpses.

    Additionally: On the day of Jiayin, the three corpses wander in both hands, so cut off the fingernails; on the day of Jiawu, the three corpses wander in both feet, so cut off the toenails.

    The dual alchemy of yin and yang: Those who refine autumn stones usually only apply the method of fire refinement. However, this medicine must combine both yin and yang refinement to be the ultimate medicine. Fire refinement is the yin within yang, solidifying in fire, dissolving in water, returning to formlessness, where essence departs but flavor remains. This is the vacancy within separation. Water refinement is the yang within yin, solidifying in water, moistening when exposed, unchanged for a thousand years, with flavor departing but essence remaining. This is the reality within the pit. Both substances originate from the heart and kidney and flow through the small intestine.

    By utilizing the primordial, righteous qi of water and fire, one relies on the water and fire of heaven and earth to solidify into essence. Consuming this nourishes the sun's fire in the two organs, serving as the foundation of life. With an empty heart, consume the yang refinement; at noon, consume the yin refinement. This method is extremely labor-saving and not comparable to ordinary methods. Those suffering from chronic illnesses will find relief. Someone who has become emaciated and coughs, for whom various methods have failed, will heal upon consumption. Someone afflicted with a distended abdomen and chronic shortness of breath will also find peace after consuming this.[166p]

    阳炼法：用人尿十余石，各用桶盛，每石入皂荚汁一碗，竹杖即搅百千下，候澄去清留垽，并作一桶，如前搅拨，澄取浓汁一二斗，滤净，入锅熬干，刮下捣细，再以清汤煮化，用箕铺纸，淋过再熬。如此数次，直待色白如雪方止。用沙盒固济，火煅成质，倾出。如药未成，更煅一二次，候色如莹玉，细研，入沙盒内固济，微火养十昼夜取出，于土上去火毒，为末，枣膏丸梧桐子大，每空心温酒下三十丸。其阴炼法：用人尿四五石，以水缸盛，入新水一半，搅千回，澄定去清留渣；又入新水搅澄，直候无臭气，澄下如腻粉，方以曝干刮下再研，以男儿乳和如膏，烈日晒干，盖假太阳真气也。如此九度，为末，枣膏和丸梧子大，每午后温酒下三十丸。【《水云录》】[167p]

    Yang refining method: Use over ten stones of human urine, each stored in a barrel. For each stone, add one bowl of soap pod juice, and stir with a bamboo stick for hundreds of times. Wait for it to settle; discard the clear liquid and keep the sediment, making it into one barrel. Stir again as before, and draw off one to two dou of concentrated juice, filter it clean, then boil it dry in a pot. Scrape it down and pound it finely, then dissolve it with clear broth. Spread it on paper using a winnowing basket and strain it before boiling again. Repeat this multiple times until it reaches a white color like snow. Solidify it in a sand box and calcine it to form a solid. Pour it out. If the medicine isn't formed, continue to calcine one or two more times until it has a color like gleaming jade. Grind it finely and place it in the sand box for solidification. Let it mature over ten nights on a gentle fire, then take it out and remove the fire toxins. Grind it into a powder and form it into pills the size of a large Chinese date, taking thirty pills with warm wine. For the Yin refining method: Use four to five stones of human urine, storing it in a water vat, and add half new water. Stir a thousand times, settle, and discard the clear liquid to keep the residue. Add new water again and stir until there is no foul odor, and the settled liquid is like greasy powder, then dry it in the sun and scrape it down to grind. Mix it with the milk of a male child until it forms a paste, then dry it under the scorching sun to capture its true essence. Repeat this nine times, form a powder, and mix it with jujube paste into pills the size of a large Chinese date, taking thirty pills with warm wine every afternoon.[167p]

    　　秋冰乳粉丸：固元阳，壮筋骨，延年不老，却百病。用秋冰五钱，头生男乳晒粉五钱，头生女乳晒粉五钱，乳香二钱五分，麝香一分为末，炼蜜丸芡子大，金箔为衣，乌金纸包黄蜡匮收，勿令泄气。每月用乳汁化服一丸，仍日饮乳汁助之。
    　　秋水法：用童男童女尿垽各一桶，入大锅内，桑柴火熬干，刮下，入河水一桶，搅化隔纸淋过，复熬刮下，再以水淋，炼之。如此七次，其色如霜。或有一斤入罐内，上用铁澄盏盖定，盐泥固济，升打三炷香，看秋石色如玉再研，再如前升起灯盏，上用水徐徐擦之。不可多，多则不结；不可少，少则不升。自辰至未，退火冷定，其盏上升起者为秋冰，味淡而香，乃秋石之精英也。服之滋肾水，固元阳，降痰火。其不升者，即寻常秋石也，味咸苦，蘸肉食之，亦有小补。【《经验方》】[168p]

    Autumn Ice Milk Powder Pills: These pills solidify yang, strengthen muscles and bones, prolong life, and prevent diseases. The ingredients are five qian of autumn ice, five qian of powdered milk from male infants, five qian of powdered milk from female infants, two and a half qian of frankincense, and one fen of musk, all ground into powder. Form them into pills the size of lotus seeds, coated with gold leaf, and wrapped in black paper with yellow wax to prevent air from escaping. Take one pill each month dissolved in milk, and continue to drink milk daily to assist.

    Autumn Water Method: Use one bucket each of urine from a young boy and a girl, combining them in a large pot, then using mulberry wood to boil it down until dry. Scrape it down, add one bucket of river water, stir, and strain through paper. Boil down again, scrape, and wet it with water, refining it. Repeat this process seven times until it takes on a frost-like color. One pound is placed in a jar, covered tightly with an iron lid, sealed with salt mud, and burned with three incense sticks. Once the autumn stone achieves a jade-like color, grind it again. As before, use a lamp with water and gently rub it. Care must be taken not to add too much, as it will not solidify, but also not too little, or it will not rise. From the hour of Chen to Wei, let the fire retire and cool, and the substance that rises above will be autumn ice, which tastes mild and fragrant and is the essence of autumn stone. Taking this nourishes kidney water, solidifies yang, and diminishes phlegm heat. What does not rise is ordinary autumn stone, which tastes salty and bitter; it can also slightly replenish when used with meat.[168p]

    　　吴贞君服椒方：椒性禀五行，其叶青，其皮赤，其华黄，其膜白，其实黑。暖丹府，通血脉，助元气，消酒食，辟温毒，祛邪气，安五脏，调三焦，而热不上蒸，芳草之中，功皆莫及。每川椒一斤，拣去浮及合口者并目，银器内炒令透，地上铺纸两重，倾在纸上，用新盆合定，周围以黄土培，半日许，其毒成汗自出，晒干，木臼内轻捣，取红皮四五两，再入铁臼杵为末，以炼蜜为丸如梧桐子大，候干，纱袋盛，挂通风处。每日空心酒下十丸至十五丸，半年加至二十丸，一年后加至二十五丸。百无所忌。[169p]

    The text describes the properties and uses of pepper according to Wu Zhenjun:

    Pepper is associated with the five elements: its leaves are green, its skin is red, its flowers are yellow, its membranes are white, and its fruits are black. It warms the Danfu (the elixir field), facilitates blood circulation, boosts vital energy, dispels alcohol and food toxins, prevents warmth-related diseases, eliminates evil spirits, calms the five organs, and regulates the three burners, ensuring heat does not rise excessively. Among fragrant herbs, its efficacy stands unmatched.

    Take one pound of river pepper, remove any floaters and impurities, and then stir-fry in a silver container until it becomes translucent. Spread two layers of paper on the ground, pour the pepper onto the paper, cover it with a new basin, and surround it with yellow earth. After about half a day, its toxins will sweat out on their own; dry it in the sun. Then, lightly pound in a wooden mortar, taking four to five taels of the red skin. Next, grind it in an iron mortar to a fine powder, and mix it with honey to form pills the size of a phoenix seed. Wait for them to dry, then store them in a gauze bag and hang in a ventilated area.

    Take ten to fifteen pills on an empty stomach with wine daily, increasing to twenty pills after six months, and twenty-five pills after a year. There are no restrictions on consumption.[169p]

    　　人乳汁：补五脏，益年，令人肥白悦泽。取甘香乳汁入银器内，顿滚，五更时热服。每一吸，即以指塞鼻孔按唇贴齿而漱，乳与口津相合，然后以鼻引上吸，使气由明堂入脑，方可徐徐咽下。凡五七次为一度，久服甚佳。歌曰：仙家酒，仙家酒，两个壶卢盛一斗。五行酿出真醍醐，不离人间处处有。丹田若是干涸时，咽下重楼润枯朽。清晨能饮一升余，返老还童天地久。
    　　枸杞酒方：枸杞根一百二十斤切，以东流水四石，煮一日一夜，取清汁一石，清曲一，如家酝法，熟取清，贮不津器中。内干地黄末二升半，桂心、干姜、泽泻、蜀椒末各一升，商陆末二升，以绢袋贮内酒底，紧塞口，埋入地三尺，坚覆上，三七日。沐浴整衣冠再拜，平晓向甲寅地日出时开之。其酒亦如金色，旦空腹服半升，十日万病皆愈。三十日瘢痕灭，恶疾去。[170p]

    Human breast milk: Nourishes the five organs, benefits longevity, and makes one plump, fair, and radiant. Take sweet and fragrant milk, place it in a silver vessel, bring to a rolling boil, and consume it hot at the fifth watch of the night. For each sip, block one nostril with a finger, press the lips against the teeth and swish, combining the milk with the saliva, then inhale through the nose, allowing the breath to enter the brain through the bright hall before slowly swallowing. Repeat this five to seven times in one session; consuming this regularly is excellent. A song says: "Immortal's wine, immortal's wine, two jars hold one斗. The five elements brew true nectar, everywhere in the secular world found. When the dantian is dry, swallow the heavy building to moisten the withered and decayed. In the early morning, drinking over a liter can return one to youth for long."

    Goji berry wine method: Take 120 pounds of goji roots, cut them up, add four stones of flowing water, and boil for a day and night. Extract one stone of clear juice, and use one clear starter, following home brewing methods, to obtain clear liquor, storing it in a non-permeable vessel. Mix in two and a half sheng of dry root powder, one sheng each of cinnamon bark, dried ginger, alisma, and sichuan pepper powder, and two sheng of commercial land powder. Store these in a silk bag inside the wine, tightly seal the bag, bury it three feet underground, and cover it well for thirty-seven days. After bathing and dressing, bow down and open it at dawn when the sun rises in the direction of Jia-yin. The wine will also be golden in color; on an empty stomach, consume half a liter for ten days, and all ailments will be cured. In thirty days, scars will disappear, and serious illnesses will go away.[170p]

    　　服食松叶，细切更研，每日食前以酒调下二钱，亦可煮汁作粥食。初服稍难，久则自便矣。令人不老，轻身益气，久服不已，绝谷不饥渴。
    　　饵茯苓法：用白茯苓三斤细銼，以绢袋盛之，悬于瓮中。用小麦细面七斤，糯米五斗，炊为烂饭，和曲末；经宿，入蜜一升，和令匀，入瓮中；又经一宿，炊糯米二斗投之，不得令热，入水六石，即封其瓮口，春秋三、七日，冬五、七日，夏一日，当出其药袋。可隔宿不食，清旦取茯苓半斤服之，其酒即旋旋饮之，勿令胜药。若服此药多时者，永不饥渴，无寒无热，身如碧玉，令人身轻，走如奔马，与天地相毕矣。其药袋悬于空中，勿令着瓮底，绳系袋头，取木枙横之，仍以纸密封，旋取服之，勿令泄气。忌食米酢。
    　　葡萄酒：驻颜色，暖腰肾。干葡萄一斤末，细曲五斤末，糯米五斗，炊糯米熟候冷，入曲并葡萄末，水三斗，搅令匀，入瓮盖覆，俟熟即时饮一盏，不拘时。[171p]

    Consume pine leaves, finely chopped and ground; each day before meals, take two qian mixed with wine, or boil the juice to make porridge. At first, it may be difficult to ingest, but over time it becomes easier. It prevents aging, lightens the body, boosts energy, and if taken continuously, one will never feel hunger or thirst.

    Method for taking Fu Ling: Use three jin of white Fu Ling finely shredded, put into a silk bag, and hang it in a jar. Use seven jin of fine wheat flour and five dou of glutinous rice, cook them to make mushy rice, and mix with the powdered ferment; leave overnight. Then add one sheng of honey, mix evenly, and place in the jar. Let it sit for another night, then add two dou of glutinous rice without letting it get hot, along with six shi of water, sealing the mouth of the jar. In spring and autumn, leave for three to seven days; in winter, for five to seven days; in summer, for one day. The medicine bag should be taken out after the time specified. You can fast overnight; upon rising, take half a jin of Fu Ling and drink the wine afterwards, ensuring it doesn’t overpower the medicine. If taken for a long time, one will never feel hunger or thirst, will be free from cold and heat, and the body will feel as light as jade, enabling one to run swiftly like a galloping horse, keeping in harmony with the heavens and the earth. Keep the medicine bag hanging in the air, avoiding contact with the bottom of the jar, tying the bag’s head with a string, placing a wooden crossbar over it, and sealing it tightly with paper to prevent air leakage. Avoid eating rice vinegar.

    Grape wine: It enhances color and warms the kidneys. Use one jin of dried grapes finely powdered, five jin of fine ferment, and five dou of glutinous rice; cook the glutinous rice until soft and let it cool. Then add the ferment and grape powder, mix evenly with three dou of water, place in a jar with a cover, and drink a cup as soon as it is ready, without limitation on timing.[171p]

    　　甘菊花：轻身耐老，延年。苗叶花根皆可服，阴干捣末，酒调服，或蜜丸久服。 【《本草》】
    　　菊花酒：壮筋骨，补髓延年，益寿耐老。甘菊花、生地黄、枸杞根皮各五升，水一石，煮取五斗，糯米五斗，煮熟，细曲和匀，入瓮候熟，澄酒温服。白菊尤佳。【《入门》，下同】
    　　天门冬酒：天门冬根捣绞汁二斗，糯米饭二斗，拌细曲如常酿法，候熟取清饮。干者作末酿之亦可。忌食鲤鱼。
    　　逡巡酒：补气血虚，去一切风痹湿气，久服益寿耐老，好颜色。造法：三月三日，收桃花三两三钱，五月五日收马蔺花五两五钱，六月六日收芝麻花六两六钱，九月九日收黄甘菊花九两九钱，阴干。十二月八日，取腊水三斗，待春分取桃仁四十九枚，好者去皮尖，白面十斤，正同前花和作曲，纸包四十九日。用时白水一瓶，曲一丸，面二块，封良久成矣。如淡，则再加一丸。[172p]

    Sweet Chrysanthemum: Light in body and resistant to aging, it prolongs life. The sprouts, leaves, flowers, and roots can all be consumed; they should be dried in the shade, ground into powder, and taken mixed with wine or made into honey pills for long-term consumption.

    Chrysanthemum Wine: Strengthens bones, replenishes marrow, prolongs life, and resists aging. Use five sheng each of sweet chrysanthemum, raw rehmannia, and goji root bark, with one stone of water; boil to obtain five dou. Use five dou of glutinous rice, cook it thoroughly, mix in fine yeast evenly, and let it mature in a jar. Clear the wine and drink it warm. White chrysanthemum is particularly good.

    Tianmendong Wine: Crush two dou of tianmendong root to extract juice, mix with two dou of glutinous rice, and combine with fine yeast as per usual brewing methods. After maturing, drink clear. The dried version can also be ground and brewed. Avoid eating carp.

    Rejuvenating Wine: Nourishes qi and blood deficiencies, dispels all wind, damp, and phlegm, and long-term consumption improves longevity and complexion. Preparation: On the third day of the third lunar month, gather three liang and three qian of peach blossoms; on the fifth of May, collect five liang and five qian of water chestnut flowers; on the sixth of June, gather six liang and six qian of sesame flowers; on the ninth of September, collect nine liang and nine qian of yellow sweet chrysanthemum flowers; dry them in the shade. On the eighth day of the twelfth month, take three dou of lard, and wait until spring equinox to add forty-nine peach kernels, removing the skin and tips from the good ones; add ten jin of white flour to combine with the prepared flowers for the yeast, and wrap it in paper for forty-nine days. When using, mix one ball of yeast with one bottle of water and two pieces of dough; seal for a long time until ready. If it is too weak, add another ball.[172p]

    　　地黄酒：补虚弱，壮筋骨，通血脉，治腹痛，变白发。用生地绞汁，同曲末封密器中，五七日，启之，中有绿汁，真精英也。宜先饮之，乃滤汁藏贮。加牛膝汁，效更速。亦有加群药者。
    　　牛膝酒：壮筋骨，治痿痹，补虚损，除久疟。用牛膝煎汁和曲米酿酒；或切碎袋盛，浸酒煮服。
    　　当归酒：和血脉，坚筋骨，止诸痛，调经水。当归煎汁，或酿或浸，并如上法。
    　　人参酒：补中益气，通治诸虚。用人参末，同曲米酿酒，或袋盛浸酒，煮饮。
    　　黄精酒：壮筋骨，益精髓，变白发，治百病。用黄精、苍朮各四斤，枸杞根、柏叶各五斤，天门冬三斤，煮汁一石，同曲十斤，糯米一石，如常酿酒饮。[173p]

    Dihuang Wine: Strengthens weakness, fortifies muscles and bones, promotes blood circulation, treats abdominal pain, and restores gray hair. Use fresh Dihuang to extract juice, mix with powdered Qu and seal in a container for five to seven days. Once opened, there will be green juice, a true essence. It is advisable to drink this first, then filter the juice for storage. Adding Niuxi juice can enhance the effect. Some also incorporate various other herbs.

    Niuxi Wine: Strengthens muscles and bones, treats atrophy and paralysis, replenishes deficiencies, and alleviates chronic malaria. Use Niuxi to brew juice mixed with Qu rice; alternatively, chop finely and store in a bag, then soak in wine and cook for consumption.

    Danggui Wine: Harmonizes the blood, strengthens muscles and bones, alleviates pain, and regulates menstrual flow. Brew Danggui juice, or ferment or soak, following the aforementioned methods.

    Renshen Wine: Supplements energy and benefits the body, treating various deficiencies. Use powdered Renshen, mix with Qu rice for brewing, or store in a bag to soak in wine, then boil for drinking.

    Huangjing Wine: Strengthens muscles and bones, enriches essence and marrow, restores gray hair, and treats numerous ailments. Use four pounds each of Huangjing and Cangzhu, five pounds each of Wolfberry root and Cypress leaves, and three pounds of Asparagus; boil down to one stone of juice, mix with ten pounds of Qu and one stone of glutinous rice, and brew wine as usual for consumption.[173p]

    　　戊戌酒：大补元阳。其性大热，阴虚无冷病人，不宜饮之。用黄狗肉一只，煮糜连汁，和曲米酿酒饮之。
    　　羊肉酒：大补元气，健脾胃，益腰肾。宣和化成殿真方，用米一石，如常浸浆，嫩肥羊肉七斤，曲十四两，杏仁一斤，同煮烂，连汁拌入末，入木香一两，同酿。勿犯水。十日熟，极甘滑。　　又法：羊肉五斤，蒸烂酒浸一宿，入消梨七个，同捣取汁，和曲米酿酒饮之。
    　　腽肭脐酒：助阳气，益精髓，破症结冷气，大补益人。腽肭脐酒浸擂烂，同曲米，如常酿酒饮之。
    　　延寿酒：黄精、苍朮各四斤，天门冬三斤，松叶六斤，枸杞五斤，水三硕，煮一日，熬如酿酒法，空心服之。【《中藏经》】
    　　固本酒：治劳补虚，益寿延年，乌须发，美容颜。生干地黄、熟地黄、天门冬、麦门冬，并去心；白茯苓、人参各一两。右銼，用磁缸盛，好酒十壶，浸药三日，文武火煮一二时，以酒黑色为度，空心服三五杯。【《卫生方》】[174p]

    Wuxu Wine: Greatly replenishes the primal yang. Its nature is very warming; it is not suitable for those with yin deficiency and without cold-related illness. Use one yellow dog, boil with rice until soupy, then brew wine with the mixture.

    Lamb Meat Wine: Greatly replenishes primal energy, strengthens the spleen and stomach, and benefits the waist and kidneys. According to the Xuanzhao transformation formula, use one stone of rice, soaked as usual; add seven pounds of tender, fatty lamb meat, fourteen taels of fermentation starter, and one pound of almonds, and boil until soft. Blend the juice into the mixture, add one tael of wood incense, and brew. Avoid water. It matures in ten days, extremely sweet and smooth.

    Another method: Use five pounds of lamb meat, steam it until soft, soak it in wine overnight, then add seven pears, and mash to extract the juice. Brew wine with the mixture.

    Pangziqi Wine: Aids yang energy, benefits essence and marrow, disperses cold stagnation, and greatly nourishes the body. Soak and mash pangziqi, add fermentation starter, and brew wine as usual.

    Longevity Wine: Use four pounds each of huangjing and cangzhu, three pounds of tianmendong, six pounds of pine needles, and five pounds of goji berries, with three sheng (about a liter) of water. Boil for one day, then simmer as one would for brewing wine; take on an empty stomach.

    Foundation Wine: Treats fatigue and deficiency, promotes longevity, restores dark hair, and beautifies the face. Use raw and cooked dihuang, tianmendong, and maimendong, discarding the cores; one tael of white poria and ginseng each. Grind and place in a ceramic jar, add ten jars of good wine, soak the herbs for three days, then boil over gentle fire for one to two hours until the wine turns black; take three to five cups on an empty stomach.[174p]

    　　乌须酒：治同上，黄米三斗，麦门冬八两，生地黄、何首乌各四两，天门冬、熟地黄、枸杞子、牛膝、当归各二两，人参一两。右为末，入好曲拌饭如常酿法，待酒熟榨出取清，每日清晨饮一二杯，微醺为度。忌白酒萝卜葱蒜牛肉。黄米即粘黍，米色黄。【《回春》】
    　　长松酒：滋补一切风虚，乃庐山休休子所传。长松一两五钱，状似独活而香，乃酒中圣药也。熟地黄八钱，生地黄、黄芪蜜炙、陈皮各七钱，当归、厚朴、黄蘗各五钱，白芍药煨、人参、枳壳各四钱，苍朮米泔制、半夏制、天门冬、麦门冬、砂仁、黄连各三钱，木香、川椒、核桃仁各二钱，小红枣肉八个，老米一撮，灯心五寸长，一百二十根。一料分十剂，绢袋盛之。糯米五升，造酒一尊煮一袋，窨久乃饮。【《医通》】[175p]

    Black Mustache Wine: The preparation is as above: three dou of yellow millet, eight liang of Ophiopogon, four liang each of Rehmannia glutinosa and Fo-Ti, two liang each of Asparagus, cooked Rehmannia glutinosa, Goji berries, Achyranthes, and Angelica, one liang of ginseng. Grind the above into a fine powder, mix it with good starter and rice as in usual brewing methods, wait until the wine is ready, press out and take the clear liquid. Drink one or two cups each morning, enough to feel slightly tipsy. Avoid white wine, radishes, scallions, garlic, and beef. Yellow millet refers to sticky sorghum, which is yellow in color.

    Long Pine Wine: This nourishes all forms of deficiency and is passed down from the Ruyizhi of Mount Lu. One and a half liang of Long Pine, resembling Ligusticum and fragrant, is the holy medicine of wine. Eight qian of cooked Rehmannia glutinosa, seven qian each of honey-fried Astragalus, and dried citrus peel, five qian each of Angelica, Magnolia bark, and Coptis, four qian each of white peony root, ginseng, and bitter orange peel, three qian each of Atractylodes, prepared pinellia, Asparagus, Ophiopogon, cardamom, and Coptis, two qian each of saussurea, Sichuan pepper, and walnut kernels, the flesh of eight small red dates, a pinch of old rice, and one hundred and twenty five-inch pieces of lampwick. Divide this into ten doses, store it in a silk bag. Use five sheng of glutinous rice to make a batch of wine and boil a bag, then steep for a long time before drinking.[175p]

    　　莲子粥：补中强志，聪耳明目。用莲实半两，去皮心，研末，水煮熟，以粳米三合作粥，入末搅匀食。【《圣惠》】

    　　稷米粥：补中益气。羊肉一角熬汤，入河西稷米，葱盐煮粥食之。 【《饮膳正要》】[176p]
