    　　紫芝：利关节，保神益精气，坚筋骨，好颜色，久服轻身不老，延年。
    　　　　针灸

    　　《医学入门》曰：夫人之脐也，受生之初，父精母血，相授凝结，胞胎混沌，　太极未分之时，一气分得二穴，穴中如产四穴，外通二肾，内长赤白二脉。四穴之中，分为表里。在母腹中，母呼儿呼，母吸儿吸。是一身脐蒂，如花果在枝而通蒂也。一月一周，真气渐足。既产，胎衣未脱，脐带且缓断。倘脐门未闭，感风伤寒，即损婴儿真气。遂以艾火熏蒸数次，则真气无患矣。三七脐门自闭。惟觉口深。于是阳盛年长，汨于五味，溺于五音，探于五气，外耗精神，内伤生冷，而真气不得条畅。所以立法蒸脐固蒂，如水灌土培，草木根本自壮茂也。[178p]

    Red Reishi: Benefits the heart energy, supplements the center, increases wisdom, aids memory, and when consumed for a long time, lightens the body and prevents aging, prolonging life like an immortal.
    Yellow Reishi: Benefits the spleen energy and calms the spirit, is loyal and harmonious with medicines, and when consumed for a long time, lightens the body and prevents aging, prolonging life like an immortal.
    White Reishi: Benefits the lung energy, opens and unblocks the mouth and nose, strengthens will and courage, calms the soul, and when consumed for a long time, lightens the body and prevents aging, prolonging life.
    Purple Reishi: Benefits the joints, protects the spirit and enhances vital energy, strengthens the muscles and bones, improves complexion, and when consumed for a long time, lightens the body and prevents aging, prolonging life.

    Acupuncture

    The "Medical Entry" states: The navel of a person, at the beginning of life, receives the father's essence and the mother's blood, which coalesce. In the womb, during the formless chaos when the supreme ultimate has not yet separated, the vital energy divides into two apertures, appearing like the four points of emergence, externally linking to the two kidneys, internally nurturing the red and white meridians. Among the four points, there is a division of exterior and interior. In the mother's belly, the mother breathes and the child breathes; the mother inhales and the child inhales. It is like a navel connecting as flowers and fruits on branches. After one month and one week, the genuine energy gradually becomes sufficient. Upon birth, the placenta has not yet detached, and the umbilical cord is loosely severed. If the navel remains open, exposure to wind or cold may harm the infant's true energy. Thus, by fumigating with moxa several times, the true energy will be safeguarded. At three to seven days, the navel closes. Only then does it feel deep in the mouth. Therefore, as yang becomes exuberant and ages, it indulges in the five tastes, is drained by the five sounds, and is affected by the five qi, externally exhausting vital energy and internally suffering from cold, preventing the smooth flow of true energy. Thus, laws are established to steam the navel and secure the connection, like watering the soil so that grass and trees thrive.[178p]

    人常依法熏蒸，则荣卫调和，安魂定魄，寒暑不侵，身体可健，其中有神妙也。夫肺为五脏之华盖，声音所从生者，皮毛赖之而滋润，肾水由之而生养，腠理不密，外感内伤乘之，令人咳嗽。外感发散，内伤滋润。又有郁结，则当解之。或伤辛燥之药，或未发散，而遂使郁遏之剂，则气不散而滞于肺中，多生粘痰，而作喘急咳嗽。或伤房劳，饮食，致使吐血，乍寒乍热，耳目昏昏，身体倦怠拘急，胸满烦闷，饮食少思，精神怯弱等疾作矣。医者可急用保真丸、化痰丸等剂疗之。倘用之无效，必须依法熏脐。今将此方药料，开具于后，名曰彭祖壮阳固蒂长生延寿丹。[179p]

    When one frequently uses this method of fumigation, then harmony and balance are achieved, the soul is settled, and the body is protected from cold and heat, leading to good health, which has a certain marvelous effect. The lungs are like the canopy of the five organs, from which the voice arises. The skin and fur depend on it for nourishment, and kidney essence is generated from it. If the pores are not tightly closed, external pathogens can invade and cause internal injuries, resulting in coughing. External factors can disperse, while internal injuries can cause dampness. If there are blockages, they should be resolved. If one uses harsh or drying medicinals or fails to disperse, this can lead to stagnant energy in the lungs, producing excessive phlegm and causing wheezing and coughing. If there is damage from labor or diet leading to blood vomit, with sudden chills and fevers, feelings of fatigue, mental fog, a heavy chest, diminished appetite, and weak spirit, then these ailments arise. Physicians may urgently use medicinal pills like Baozhen Wan or Huatan Wan to treat these conditions. If they are ineffective, one must fumigate the navel according to the method. Hereafter, I will provide this prescription, named the Pengzu Pill for Enhancing Yang, Firming Foundations, and Promoting Longevity.[179p]

    其法用麝香五分，引诸药入五脏六腑，周彻百节；丁香三钱，入肺补血实脾胃；青盐四钱入肾，以实其子，使肺母无泄漏，如乳母哺子，益其气血；夜明砂五钱，透肺孔，补气不足散，内伤有余；乳香、木香各三钱，小茴四钱，治湿沥之证，调遣周流，升降其气，不致喘咳，如欲断水，先寻此源；没药、虎骨、蛇骨、龙骨、朱砂各五钱，雄黄三钱，削除病根，扶弱锄强；白附子五钱，循各经络，有推前拽后之功；人参、附子、胡椒各七钱，补元气，行血化痰为津液；五灵脂五钱，保肺气，削有余补不足；槐皮能闭押诸药之性，使无走窜；艾叶取其火势，劫病去毒，起死回生。右为末，另用白面作条圈于脐上，将前药一料分为三分，内取一分，先填麝香末五分，入脐眼内。[180p]

    The method utilizes five parts of musk, bringing various herbs into the five zang organs and six fu organs, circulating through all joints; three qians of clove are used to nourish the lungs and strengthen the spleen and stomach; four qians of blue salt enter the kidneys to solidify the essence, preventing leakage from the lung mother, much like a wet nurse nurturing a child, enhancing vitality and blood; five qians of night-bright sand penetrate the lung openings, replenishing insufficient qi and dispersing excess from internal injuries; three qians each of frankincense and agarwood, and four qians of fennel seed are prescribed to treat dampness and fluid retention, regulating flow and ascending or descending qi to prevent wheezing and coughing, as if seeking to stem a water source, one must first locate its origin; five qians each of myrrh, tiger bone, snake bone, dragon bone, and vermilion, alongside three qians of realgar, aim to remove the root of the illness, supporting the weak and eliminating the strong; five qians of white attached herb follow the meridians, having the ability to push forward and pull back; seven qians each of ginseng, prepared aconite, and black pepper nourish the original qi, promote blood flow, and transform phlegm into fluids; five qians of five-spirit resin protect lung qi, addressing excess and deficiency; the skin of the locust tree can contain the properties of all herbs, preventing them from wandering; mugwort leaves harness fire to dispel illness and toxins, facilitating revival from death. This is the powder mixture. Additionally, use white flour to make a ring around the navel, taking the prepared herbs divided into three parts, and place one part inside, adding five parts of musk powder into the navel.[180p]

    又将前药一分，入面圈内，按药令紧，中插数孔，外用槐皮一片盖于药上，艾火灸之，无时损易，壮其热气。或自上而下，自下而上，一身热透，患人必倦沉如醉。灸至五六十壮，遍身大汗，上至泥丸宫，下至涌泉穴。如此则骨髓风寒暑湿、五劳七伤尽皆拔除。苟不汗则病未愈，再于三五日后又灸，灸至汗出为度，学者须用小心。灸至百二十壮，则疾必痊。灸时要慎风寒，戒油腻生冷。保养一月之后，愈加精神健旺。若妇人灸脐，去麝加韶脑一钱。扁鹊明此二十味，浮沉升降，君臣佐使，其所治劳嗽之疾，无不痊愈。不惟劳疾，凡一年四季，各熏一次，元气坚固，百病不生。及久嗽久喘，吐血寒劳，遗精白浊，阳事不举，下元极弱，精神失常，痰膈等疾；妇人赤白带下，久无生育，子宫极冷，凡用此灸，则百病顿除，益气延年。　　《养老书》曰：有人年老而颜如童子者，盖每岁以鼠粪灸脐中一壮故也。[181p]

    Furthermore, divide the previous medicine and place it inside the inner circle, pressing the medicine firmly. Insert several holes in between, cover it with a piece of sophora bark, and perform moxibustion with mugwort fire. This should not harm or easily damage, but strengthen the heat. Whether treating from top to bottom or bottom to top, the heat spreads throughout the body, making the patient feel fatigued as if intoxicated. When moxibustion is applied vigorously fifty to sixty times, profuse sweating occurs, from the Baihui point at the top to the Yongquan point at the bottom. In this way, all cold, heat, humidity, and the seven injuries and five strains are completely removed. If sweating does not occur, the illness has not yet been cured; repeat the moxibustion after three to five days until sweating reaches an appropriate level, and practitioners must be careful. When moxibustion reaches one hundred twenty times, the illness will surely heal. During the moxibustion, be cautious of wind and cold, avoiding greasy and cold foods. After one month of care, the energy will be even more vigorous.

    If a woman undergoes moxibustion on the navel, remove the musk and add one qian of safflower. Bian Que made clear with these twenty ingredients, rising and falling in balance, the roles of monarch, minister, assistant, and messenger; any labor cough ailments can be cured. Not only labor ailments, but if performed once in every season, the vital energy will become strong, and a hundred diseases will not arise. For persistent cough, breathlessness, coughing up blood, cold fatigue, seminal emission, weakness of yang, mental imbalance, phlegm obstruction, and for women experiencing prolonged white or red discharge, unable to conceive, with a very cold uterus; using this moxibustion, a hundred ailments will be swiftly removed, enhancing energy and prolonging life.

    The "Book of Aging" states: Those who are old yet have a youthful appearance do so by moxibusting the navel with mouse droppings once a year.[181p]

    　　　　导引

    　　《千金方》曰：天竺国按摩法，两手摄捉纽捩，如洗手法，两手浅相叉，翻覆向胸。　　两手相捉共按(月坒)，左右同。
    　　以手如挽五石力弓，左右同。
    　　两手相重按(月坒)，徐徐捩身，左右同。　　作拳向前筑，左右同。
    　　作拳却顿，此是开胸，左右同。[182p]

    Guidance

    The "Thousand Gold Prescriptions" states: In the country of Tianzhu, the technique of massage involves the hands grasping and twisting, similar to the method of washing hands. The two hands lightly interlace and turn towards the chest.

    When the hands come together to press, they do so symmetrically on both sides.
    Using the hands as if pulling a bow with the strength of five stones, this is also done symmetrically.
    The hands press down together, twisting the torso slowly, and this is done on both sides.
    Form a fist and move it forward, doing this symmetrically on both sides.
    Form a fist and pull back; this opens the chest, also done symmetrically.[182p]

    　　如拓石法，左右同。
    　　以拳反搥背上，左右同。
    　　两手据地，缩身曲脊，向上三举。
    　　两手抱头，宛转(月坒)上，此是抽胁。　　大坐斜身，偏欹如排山，左右同。
    　　大坐伸两脚，即以一脚向前虚掣，左右同。　　两手拒地回顾，此虎视法，左右同。　　立地反拗身，三举。
    　　两手急相叉，以脚踏手中，左右同。　　起立以脚前后虚踏，左右同。
    　　大坐伸两脚，当两手相勾，所伸脚着膝中，以手按之，左右同。　　右十八势，但是老人日能依此行三遍者，一月后除百病，行及奔马，补益延年，能食，眼明轻健，不复疲乏。　　《医学入门》曰：导引者，保养中一事也。盖人之精神极欲静，气欲极动。但后世方士，亦以此惑人为仙术。所以王褒颂曰：何必偃仰屈伸若彭祖，吹嘘呼吸如乔松，渺然绝俗离世哉！认真只是舞蹈，以养血脉。意其法虽粗，有益闭关守病之士。盖终日屹屹端坐，最是生病。[183p]

    The stone-tapping method is the same on both sides.
    With fists, strike the back, the same on both sides.
    With both hands on the ground, contract the body and bend the spine, lifting upward three times.
    With both hands holding the head, twist (like the moon setting) upwards; this is the method for pulling in the waist.
    Sit deeply and tilt the body as if pushing a mountain, the same on both sides.
    While sitting deeply, stretch both legs, and with one foot, make a forward sweeping motion, the same on both sides.
    With both hands pushing against the ground, look back; this is the tiger's gaze method, the same on both sides.
    Stand up and twist the body backward, lifting three times.
    Cross both hands quickly, placing the feet on the hands, the same on both sides.
    Stand up and step forward and backwards with the feet, the same on both sides.
    While sitting deeply, stretch both legs and hook the hands together; place the extended foot on the knee and press it down, the same on both sides.
    As for the eighteen postures on the right side, those who practice them three times a day for a month will dispel a hundred illnesses, achieving the speed of running horses, enhancing longevity, becoming able to eat, with bright eyes and light body, no longer fatigued.
    The "Introduction to Medicine" states: guiding exercises are a part of maintenance. The spirit of a person strongly desires tranquility, while the qi desires extreme motion. However, in later generations, immortal practitioners have also deceived people with these as methods for becoming immortal.
    Therefore, Wang Bao praised: "There is no need to bend and stretch like Peng Zu, boast about breathing like the tall pines, detached and far removed from the mundane world!" In truth, it is simply a dance for nurturing the blood vessels. Although the method may seem rough, it benefits those who stay in seclusion to guard against illness. After all, sitting upright all day long is what most leads to illness.[183p]

    人徒知久行久立之伤人，而不知久卧久坐之尤伤人也。故录一二最要者，以备养生者择焉。　　大法：导引为虚损气血不周而设也。有火者开目，无火者闭目。无汗者闭气至极，有汗者不必闭气。欲气上行以治耳目口齿之病，则屈身为之；欲气下行以通大小二便，及健足胫，则偃身为之；欲气达于四肢，侧身为之。欲引头病者仰头，欲引腰脚病者仰足十指，欲引胸中病者挽足十指，欲引臂病者掩臂。欲去腹中寒热积聚诸痛，及中寒身热，皆闭气满腹偃卧，亦可为之。但病在头中胸中者，枕高七寸；病在心下者，高四寸；病在脐下者，去枕。[184p]

    People only know the harm of prolonged standing and walking, but do not realize that long periods of lying down or sitting are even more harmful. Therefore, I will record one or two essential points for those who seek health to consider.

    The primary method: The practice of guiding and stretching is designed to address deficiencies in qi and blood. If there is heat, keep the eyes open; if there is no heat, keep the eyes closed. If there is no sweat, hold the breath to the limit; if there is sweat, it is not necessary to hold the breath. To let qi rise and treat ailments of the ears, eyes, mouth, and teeth, bend the body; to let qi descend and facilitate urination and defecation, as well as strengthen the legs, lie down; to allow qi to reach the limbs, lie on one side. To relieve headaches, tilt the head back; to address ailments in the waist and feet, straighten the toes upward; to alleviate chest pain, pull the toes; for arm issues, cover the arm. To dispel cold and heat accumulation in the abdomen and alleviate coldness coupled with body heat, one can hold the breath, fill the abdomen, and lie down; this can also be done. However, for issues in the head and chest, raise the pillow seven inches; for problems below the heart, raise it four inches; for ailments below the navel, do not use a pillow.[184p]

    　　开关法：先以左手髀骨并肩向前圆转九数，次以右手髀骨并肩向前圆转九次，复以左右髀骨并左右肩向前圆转九次。加至一九三九亦好。但要从容和缓为之。或先缓后急，亦可为之。此法疏通膏肓，泽心包络火，与张紫丘治瘵开关药方意同，善治少劳背痛胸紧。　　起髀法：先静坐存中气，后挺身以两手相叉，极力扒左扒右各七次。扒左则头向右，扒右则头向左。如此者三五次，静坐良久。善和脾胃，进饮食，兼治臂腰拘挛，与开关法相续行之亦可。[185p]

    Switching Method: First, with the left thigh aligned with the shoulder, make nine circular rotations forward; then, with the right thigh aligned with the shoulder, make nine rotations forward. Repeat this with both thighs and shoulders, making nine rotations forward. It is also good to increase up to thirty-nine rotations in total. However, the practice should be done slowly and gently. It can also be done with a gradual start followed by increased intensity. This method clears blockages in the body, benefits the heart’s pericardium, and is similar in intention to Zhang Ziqiu's treatment for tuberculosis using the switching formula, effectively treating minor strain, back pain, and chest tightness.

    Raising Thigh Method: First, sit quietly to cultivate inner energy. Then, with both hands crossed, make strong movements to push left and right seven times each. When pushing left, turn the head to the right; when pushing right, turn the head to the left. Repeat this three to five times, then sit quietly for a long while. This method harmonizes the spleen and stomach and aids in improving appetite, as well as treating stiffness in the arms and lower back. It can also be practiced in conjunction with the Switching Method.[185p]

    　　开郁法：其法以两手旋舞，向前向后，两足作白鹭行步状，不拘数。良久复以左手搭右肩，右足搭左膝腕委中而行；右手搭左肩，左足搭右膝腕委中而行。良久复以左手向前泊腹，右足搭左膝盖而行；右手向后泊腰，左足搭右膝盖而行。良久以两手极力托天，两足极力踏地，复以两手向后向下，两足十指挽起仰面偃腹，使气下行。良久蹲倒，以两手极力攀起足后跟，足十指点起，极力低头至膝下。良久立起，以两手相交掩两臂于胸前胛上，极力摇动数次。善治名利不遂，郁气为病，心腹胀满，夜睡不宁等证。无病者亦可行之。如外感风寒，须行至汗出为度。[186p]

    The method of relieving stagnation: it involves swirling the hands in circles, moving them forward and backward, with the feet imitating the walking steps of a heron, without concern for the number of repetitions. After a long time, place the left hand on the right shoulder and the right foot on the left knee, then walk in a relaxed manner; switch to placing the right hand on the left shoulder and the left foot on the right knee, and walk in a relaxed manner. After a long time, extend the left hand forward to rest on the abdomen, while placing the right foot on the left knee and walking; extend the right hand backward to rest on the waist, while placing the left foot on the right knee and walking. After a long time, raise both hands vigorously to the sky and stomp the feet firmly on the ground, then move the hands downward and backward while curling the toes and leaning back to allow the breath to descend. After a long time, squat down and grip the heels tightly with both hands, while the toes push down, and lower the head as far as possible to the knees. After a long time, stand up and cross the hands over the arms on the chest, shaking vigorously several times. This method is effective for those troubled by unmet desires and stagnation, feelings of fullness in the heart and abdomen, and restless nights. Those without illness may also practice it. If one is affected by wind and cold from outside, one should continue until sweat breaks out as a measure.[186p]

    此法比之华氏五禽戏法，更易简，正大可行。　　《古今医统》曰：摄生之要，莫大乎存想。存谓存我之神，想谓想我之心。闭目见自己之目，收心见自己之心。不离我身，不伤我神，则存想之渐也。　　天地虚空中皆气，人身虚空中亦皆气。故呼出浊气，身中之气也；吸入清气，天地之气也。人在气中，如鱼游水中，鱼腹中不得水出入则死，人腹中不得气出入亦死，同其理也。善摄生者，必明于气之故矣。[187p]

    This method, compared to Hua's Five Animal Play, is simpler and more practical. The "Ancient and Modern Medical System" states: The key to preserving life lies in sustaining one's thoughts. "Sustaining" refers to preserving our spirit, while "thinking" refers to pondering our heart. By closing our eyes to see our own eyes and focusing our heart to see our own heart, we do not separate from our body and do not harm our spirit; thus, this is the gradual practice of sustaining thought.

    In the vast emptiness of heaven and earth, there is qi; within the human body, there is also qi. Therefore, expelling impure qi is the qi within the body; inhaling pure qi is the qi of heaven and earth. A person is in qi as a fish swims in water; if the belly of the fish cannot take in or expel water, it dies. Similarly, if the human abdomen cannot take in or expel qi, one also dies; the principle is the same. Those who are adept at preserving life must understand the nature of qi.[187p]

    欲修调气之术者，常得早食闭户，安床暖席，枕高二寸许，正身偃卧，瞑目握固，两足间相去五寸，两臂与体相去亦各五寸，先须闭气以鼻吸入，渐渐腹满，乃闭之，及不可忍，乃从口细细吐出，不可一吐即尽，气定复如前闭之，始而十息，或二十息，不可忍，渐熟渐多，但能闭至八十息以上，则脏腑胸膈之间，皆清气之布濩矣。至于纯熟，当其气闭之时，鼻中唯有短息一寸余，所闭之气四布，如火蒸润肺宫一绕，则身如委蛇神在外，其快其美，有不可言之状。盖一气流通表里，上下彻泽故也。其所闭之气渐消，则恍然复旧。此道以多为功，但能于日夜间得行此两度，久久耳目聪明，精神完固，体健身轻，则百疾消灭。[188p]

    If one wishes to master the art of regulating breath, one should often eat early, close the door, set the bed warm, raise the pillow about two inches, lie flat with the body straight, close the eyes and grip firmly, keeping the feet five inches apart, and the arms also five inches from the body. First, one must hold the breath and inhale through the nose, gradually filling the abdomen, then hold it. When it becomes unbearable, one should exhale slowly through the mouth, not letting all the breath escape at once. After the breath stabilizes, one should close it again, starting with ten breaths, or twenty breaths, until it becomes unbearable. Gradually, with practice, one can increase this, but if one can hold it for over eighty breaths, then a pure flow of clear energy fills the organs and chest. When one has perfected this practice, at the time of holding the breath, there will be only a short breath remaining in the nose, with the held breath circulating like steam nourishing the lungs, making the body feel as if it is filled with a divine spirit. The experience is indescribably delightful. This is because the breath circulates freely within and without, reaching thoroughly up and down. As the held breath gradually dissipates, one returns to a state of normalcy. This method relies on consistency; if one can practice this twice daily, over time, one's senses will become sharp, the spirit will be complete, the body healthy and light, and all ailments will be eradicated.[188p]

    凡调气之初，务要体安气和，无与意争。若不安和，且止候和，乃为之久而弗倦则善矣。闭气如降龙伏虎，须达其神理，胸膈常宜虚空，不可饱满。若气有结滞，不得宣流，觉之便当用吐法以除之，如吹嘘呵嘻咽噫呼之类是也。不然泉源壅遏，必至逆流，疮疡中满之患作矣。　　庄子曰：吹嘘呼吸，吐故纳新，熊经鸟伸为寿而已矣。此导引之士，养形之人，彭祖寿考者之所好也。是知导引之术，传自上世，其来久矣。故曰彭祖之所好，其来自修养家医家所谈，不下数百，今取其要约切当者十六条，参之诸论，大概备矣。[189p]

    When beginning to regulate the breath, it is essential to maintain tranquility and harmony, without contention with intent. If harmony is not attained, one should pause and wait for it, practicing until one does so without fatigue, which is good. Holding the breath should resemble the descending dragon or the crouching tiger; one must understand its spiritual nature. The chest and diaphragm should remain empty, not full. If the breath becomes stagnant and fails to flow, one should use exhalation methods to eliminate it, such as blowing, puffing, gasping, or sighing. Otherwise, the source will be blocked, leading to backflow, and the troubles of sores and conditions will emerge.

    Zhuangzi said: "Exhaling and inhaling, discarding the old and taking in the new, is merely an extension of life." This is what practitioners of guidance and those who nurture life, like Peng Zu who lived long, appreciate. Therefore, it is known that the art of guidance has been passed down since ancient times. Thus, it is said that Peng Zu’s preferences originate from discussions among self-cultivators and medical practitioners, encompassing several hundred teachings. Here, I present the essential and appropriate sixteen principles, supported by various texts, which collectively represent the core teachings.[189p]

    凡行导引法，常以夜半及平旦将起之时为之，此时气清腹虚，行之益人。先闭目握固，冥心危坐，叩齿三十六通，即以两手抱项，左右宛转二十四，此可以除胸胁积聚风邪。复以两手相叉，虚空托天，抑手按项二十四，此可以除胸膈间邪气。复以两手心掩两耳，却以第二指压第三指，弹击脑后二十四，此可除风池邪气。复以两手相捉，按左膝左捩身，按右膝右捩身，二十四，此可以去肝家风邪。复以左手一向前，一向后，如挽五石弓状，二十四，此可以去肾腋积邪。复大坐展两手，纫项左右反顾肩膊二十四，此可以去脾家积邪。[190p]

    The method of guiding and cultivating energy is often practiced at midnight and just before dawn, as the air is clear and the stomach is empty, which is beneficial for the practitioner. First, close your eyes and hold them firmly, sit quietly with a focused mind, and knock your teeth thirty-six times. Then, use both hands to embrace your neck, turning left and right for twenty-four times; this helps to eliminate the wind and pathogens accumulated in the chest and sides. Next, cross both hands, support empty space as if holding up the heavens, and press your hands against your neck twenty-four times; this helps to dispel the evil energy in the chest and diaphragm. Again, grab both hands, press on the left knee and twist the body to the left, press on the right knee and twist to the right, for twenty-four times; this can remove wind evil from the liver. Then, stretch your left hand forward and your right hand backward, as if drawing a bow, for twenty-four times; this can clear the accumulated evil from the kidneys. Finally, sit broad with both hands extended, turning your head left and right while glancing back at your shoulders for twenty-four times; this can help eliminate accumulated evil from the spleen.[190p]

    复两手握固，并拄两肋。摆撼两肩二十四，此可以去腰肋间风邪。复以两手反捶臂及膊连腰股各二十四，此可以去四肢胸臆之邪。复大坐斜身偏倚，两手齐向上如托天状二十四，此可以去肺间积聚之邪。复大坐伸脚，以两手向前低头攀脚二十次，却钩所伸脚屈在膝上，按摩之二十四，此可以去心胞络邪气。复以两手据地，缩身曲脊，向上十三举，此可以去心肝积邪。复起立据床，援身向背后视，左右二十四，此可以去肾间风热邪。[191p]

    First, clasp your hands tightly together and support them against your sides. Shake your shoulders twenty-four times; this can dispel the wind evil between your waist and ribs. Next, with both hands, strike your arms and shoulders, connecting with your waist and thighs, doing this twenty-four times; this can eliminate the evil from your limbs and chest. Then, sit deeply with your body leaned to one side, raising both hands upwards as if supporting the heavens for twenty-four times; this can remove the accumulated evils in your lungs. After that, while seated, stretch your legs out and lean forward with both hands to reach your feet twenty times. Bend the foot you reach, placing it on your knee, and massage it twenty-four times; this can clear the evil qi from your heart's vessels. Next, place both hands on the ground, contract your body and curve your back, raising upwards thirteen times; this can eliminate the accumulated evils from your heart and liver. Finally, stand by the bed, lean backwards while looking behind you, to the left and right twenty-four times; this can dispel the wind-heat evil in your kidneys.[191p]

    复起立徐行，两手握固，左右前蹈，左手摆向前，右手摆向后，右足前蹈，右手摆向前，左手摆向后二十四，此可以去两肩俞之邪。复以手向背上相捉，低身徐徐宛转二十四，此可以去两胁间之邪。复以足相纽而行，前进十数步，后退十数步，复高坐伸腿，将两足纽向内，各二十四，以上二条，可以去两膝及两足间风邪。行此十六节讫，复端坐闭目，握固冥心，以舌拄上腭，搅取津液，满口漱三十六次，作汨汨声咽之，复闭气想丹田火，自下而上，遍烧身体，内外蒸热乃止。[192p]

    Stand up again and walk slowly, with both hands firmly grasped. Step forward with the left foot, swinging the left hand forward and the right hand backward. Step forward with the right foot, swing the right hand forward, and the left hand backward twenty-four times. This can dispel the邪 (evil) from both shoulders. Then clasp your hands behind your back, bending forward and gently twisting twenty-four times. This can dispel the邪 between the two flanks. Next, interlock your feet and walk, stepping forward a number of steps and then backward the same. Again, sit up high and stretch your legs, interlocking both feet inward, twenty-four times. The above two sets can dispel wind邪 from both knees and between the feet. After completing these sixteen steps, sit upright, close your eyes, firm your grip, and concentrate. Place your tongue against the palate, churning saliva, swish it in your mouth thirty-six times, making a sloshing sound as you swallow. Then hold your breath and visualize the fire in your丹田 (dantian), rising from below to ignite the body, creating warmth inside and out until it ceases.[192p]

    按老子导引二十四势，婆罗门导引十二势，赤松子导引法十八势，锺离导引法十八势，胡见素五脏导引法十二势，在诸法中颇为妙解。然撮其切要，不过于此。学者能日行一二遍，久久体健身轻，百邪皆除，走及奔马，不复疲乏矣。　　太上玉轴六字气诀：道藏有《玉轴经》，言五脏六腑之气，因五味熏灼不和，六欲七情，积久生疾，内伤脏腑，外攻九窍，以至百骸受病，轻则痼癖，甚者盲废，又重则丧亡，故太上悯之。以六字气诀治五脏六腑之病。其法以呼而自泻出脏腑之毒气，以吸而自采天地之清气。当日小验，旬日大验，年后万病不生。[193p]

    According to Laozi's twenty-four guiding techniques, Brahmins have twelve techniques, Chisongzi has eighteen methods, Zhongli has eighteen methods, and Hu Jiansu's method for the five organs consists of twelve techniques, all of which provide profound insights. However, the essence can be summarized in this way. Practitioners who practice one or two times daily will gradually become fit and light, banishing all evils; they will run and gallop without fatigue.

    The "Six Characters Breathing Formula" from the Taishang Yuzhu: The Daoist canon contains the "Yuzhu Sutra," which discusses the qi of the five organs and six bowels. Imbalances from the five flavors, combined with the six desires and seven feelings, can lead to illnesses over time, injuring the organs internally and attacking the nine orifices externally, resulting in diseases throughout the body. Mild cases may result in chronic ailments, severe cases in blindness or disability, and worst cases can lead to death. Therefore, Taishang shows compassion. This six-character breathing formula addresses the illnesses of the five organs and six bowels. The method involves exhaling to release toxic gases from the organs and inhaling to gather the pure qi of heaven and earth. There are small results in one day, significant results in ten days, and after a year, one will be free from all ailments.[193p]

    延年益算，卫生之宝，非人勿传。呼有六，曰：呵、呼、呬、嘘、嘻，吹也。吸则一而已。呼有六者，以呵字治心气，以呼字治脾气，以呬字治肺气，以嘘字治肝气，以嘻字治胆气，以吹字治肾气。此六字气诀，分主五脏六腑也。凡天地之气，自子至巳为六阳时，自午至亥为六阴时。如阳时则对东方，勿尽闭窻户，然忌风入，乃解带正坐，叩齿三十六，以定神，先搅口浊津，漱炼二三百下，候口中成清水，即低头向左而咽之，以意送下，候汨汨至腹间，即低头开口，先念呵字，以吐心中毒气。念时耳不得闻呵字声，闻即气粗，反损心气也。念毕，仰头闭口，以鼻徐徐吸天地之清气，以补心气。[194p]

    Extend life and enhance calculations, a treasure of health, not to be passed on to the unworthy. Breathing has six forms: he, hu, xi, xu, xi, and chui; these are all types of exhalation. Inhalation is just one type. The six forms serve to regulate the qi of the six organs: "he" regulates the heart qi, "hu" regulates the spleen qi, "xi" regulates the lung qi, "xu" regulates the liver qi, "xi" regulates the gallbladder qi, and "chui" regulates the kidney qi. These six terms correspond to the five organs and six bowels. The atmosphere of heaven and earth has its cycles: from the Rat to the Snake is the time of six Yang, and from the Horse to the Pig is the time of six Yin. During the Yang time, face east; do not completely close windows and doors, but be cautious of wind coming in. Then loosen your belt and sit erect. Knock your teeth thirty-six times to calm your spirit. First, swirl the turbid saliva in your mouth, rinsing it two or three hundred times, waiting until the mouth is like clear water, then lower your head to the left and swallow it, guiding it down with your mind. Wait until you feel it flow smoothly to your abdomen, then lower your head again, open your mouth, and first pronounce "he" to expel the toxic qi from your heart. While pronouncing, your ears must not hear the sound of "he"; if they do, the qi will become coarse and damage the heart qi. After finishing, raise your head and close your mouth, gently inhaling the pure qi of heaven and earth through your nose to replenish the heart qi.[194p]

    吸时耳亦不得闻吸声，闻即气粗，亦损心气也。但呵时令短，吸时令长，即吐少纳多也。吸讫，即又低头，念坷字，耳复不得闻呵字声。呵讫又仰头，以鼻徐徐吸清气以补心，亦不可闻吸声。如此吸者六次，心之毒气渐散。又以天地之清气补之，心之元气亦渐复矣。又依此式念呼字，耳亦不闻呼声；又吸以补脾，耳亦不可闻吸声。如此者六，所以散脾毒而补脾元也。次又念呬字以泻肺毒，以吸而补肺元，亦须六次。[195p]

    When inhaling, the ears should not hear the sound of the breath; if they do, the breath becomes coarse, which also harms the heart’s energy. Inhale briefly and exhale longer, meaning to take less in and let more out. After inhaling, lower the head and recite the word "kē," causing the ears not to hear the sound of "hā." After exhaling, raise the head and slowly inhale pure air through the nose to replenish the heart, ensuring that the sound of inhaling is also unheard. By doing this for six times, the toxic energy of the heart gradually dissipates. Then, inhale the pure energy of heaven and earth to gradually restore the original energy of the heart. Next, follow this pattern to recite the word "hū," ensuring that the ears do not hear the sound of exhaling; then inhale to replenish the spleen, again ensuring that the sound of inhalation is unheard. Repeat this six times to dissipate the toxicity of the spleen and to restore its original energy. Lastly, recite the word "xī" to purge the toxins from the lungs, inhaling to restore the original energy of the lungs, which also needs to be done six times.[195p]

    念嘘字以泻肝毒，以吸而补肝元；嘻以泻胆毒，吸以补胆元；吹以泻肾毒，吸以补肾元。如此并各六次，是谓小周。小周者，六六三十六也。三十六而六气遍，脏腑之毒气渐消，病根渐除，胆气渐完矣。又看是何脏腑受病，如眼病，即又念嘻嘘二字，各十八遍，仍每次以吸补之。总之为三十六讫，是为中周。中周者第二次三十六通，为七十二也。次又再依前呵、呼、呬、嘘、嘻、吹六字法，各为六次，并须呼以泻之，吸以补之，愈当精虔，不可怠废，此第三次三十六也，是为大周。即总之为一百单八次，是谓百八诀也。午时属阴时，有病即对南方为之。南方属火，所以却阴毒也。[196p]

    Recite "xu" to expel liver toxins and inhale to replenish the liver essence; recite "xi" to expel gallbladder toxins and inhale to replenish the gallbladder essence; recite "chui" to expel kidney toxins and inhale to replenish the kidney essence. Do this six times for each, which is called the small cycle (Xiao Zhou). The small cycle refers to six times six, totaling thirty-six. With thirty-six and the six energies spread, the toxic gases in the organs gradually dissipate, the roots of illness gradually eliminated, and the gallbladder energy gradually completed. Observe which organ is affected; for eye ailments, recite "xi" and "xu" eighteen times each, inhaling to replenish during each session. In total, that makes thirty-six, which is called the middle cycle (Zhong Zhou). The middle cycle is the second set of thirty-six, totaling seventy-two. Then, again follow the previous method of "he," "hu," "xi," "xu," "xi," and "chui" each for six times, with inhaling to replenish and exhaling to expel; this must be done earnestly without slackening, making this the third set of thirty-six, known as the great cycle (Da Zhou). Altogether, this sums to one hundred and eight times, referred to as the Hundred Eight Method. The noon hour is associated with the yin time, so if there is illness, face the south to perform this. The south is associated with fire, which helps to dispel yin toxins.[196p]

    然又不若子后巳前，面东之为阳时也。如早起床上面柬将六字各为六次，是为小周，亦可治眼病也。凡眼中诸证，惟此诀能去之，他病亦然。神乎！神乎！此太上之慈旨也。略见玉轴真经，而详则得之师授也。如病重者，每字作五十次，凡三百而六脏周矣。乃漱炼咽液叩齿讫，复为之，又三百次讫，复漱炼咽液叩齿如初。如此者三，即通为九百次，无不愈。秘之！秘之！非人勿传。　　《石室秘箓》曰：先春养阳法：每日闭目冥心而坐，心注定肾中，咽津七口，送下丹田，起立双手自抱两胁，微摇者三，如打恭状。[197p]

    However, it is not like what you do after eating, facing east during daylight. For example, rising early and practicing the six characters six times each is known as the Small Circulation, and it can also heal eye diseases. Among all eye ailments, this method is the only one that can eliminate them, and the same applies to other illnesses. Remarkable! Remarkable! This is the benevolent intention of the Supreme. Briefly observe the genuine scripture on the jade scroll, and in detail, it can be obtained from a teacher. For those with severe illness, each character should be recited fifty times, totaling three hundred times to complete the circulation of the six organs. Then rinse and refine the saliva, clack the teeth, and repeat this for another three hundred times, followed by rinsing and refining the saliva and clacking the teeth as before. If this is done three times, it will total nine hundred times, leaving none unhealed. Keep it secret! Keep it secret! Do not pass it on to others. The "Secret Scriptures of the Stone Chamber" states: To nourish Yang in early spring: each day, close your eyes, calm your mind, and sit with your heart focused on the kidneys. Swallow saliva seven times, sending it to the dantian, then stand up and embrace your sides with both hands, gently rocking three times, like a respectful bow.[197p]

    起立俟气定，再坐如前法，咽津七口，送下丹田，永无风证之侵，一月行六次可也，多多更妙。　　先夏养阴法：每日闭目冥心而坐，心注定心中，咽津十四口，送下心中，永无暑气之侵。　　先秋养阴法：每日闭目冥心而坐，心注肺中，咽津送下丹田者十二口，以双手攀足心者三次。俟气定再如前咽津送下丹田者七口而后止，永无燥热之病。　　先冬养阳法：每日五更坐起，心注定两肾，口中候有津水送下丹田者三口，不必漱津，以手擦足心，大热而后已；再送津三口至丹田，再睡，永无伤寒之证，而长生之法亦在其中矣。长夏不必更有方法。
    [198p]

    Stand up and wait for your breath to settle, then sit again as before. Swallow saliva seven times, sending it down to the elixir field, and you will never be invaded by wind-related ailments. Doing this six times a month is sufficient; more would be even better.

    For nurturing Yin in early summer: Every day, close your eyes and meditate, focusing your heart within. Swallow saliva fourteen times, sending it down into your heart, and you will be free from summer heat invasions.

    For nurturing Yin in early autumn: Every day, close your eyes and meditate, focusing your heart in the lungs. Swallow saliva twelve times and send it down to the elixir field, then use both hands to grasp the soles of your feet three times. Wait until your breath settles, then swallow saliva seven times and send it down to the elixir field again before stopping, ensuring you will never suffer from dry heat.

    For nurturing Yang in early winter: Every day, rise at the fifth watch (around 3 AM to 5 AM) and sit, focusing your heart on the two kidneys. Swallow saliva three times to send it down to the elixir field; there’s no need to swish the saliva. Use your hands to rub the soles of your feet until they are warm, then swallow three more times down to the elixir field and sleep again. You will be free from cold-related illnesses, as the method for longevity is contained within this. There’s no need for additional methods during long summer.[198p]
